121502.name: Bloodstone
121502.description:
User Summary

A budget graphical adventure game for the Amstrad CPC. The back of the box says (translated from French):

"After crashing your car in the middle of the night, the only shelter you find is a strange mansion. What will you discover inside ?"

121505.name: Meurtres sur L'Atlantique
121505.description:
User Summary

A graphical adventure game, second installment in the "Meurtres" series by French editor Cobra Soft.

The back of the UK edition says:
"Murder on the Altantic takes place in the thrilling 1930s atmosphere of Le Bourgogne, a luxurious transatlantic liner. You play the part of the detective who finds himself mixed up in murder against a background of pre-war tensions, transatlantic speed records, spies, champagne and masked balls.

Beside the computer game program, the game comes with actual ship reports, love notes, letters, coded informations, photographs, a bullet case, button, length of wiring and lots more.

There are 40 people to cross-examine, ranging from glamorous movie stars, jazz musicians and chambermaids."

121506.name: Humanoid
121506.description:
User Summary

Science-Fiction arcade adventure game. The space pirates have intercepted communications between your mothership and the research centers scattered on the planet below. Sensing you have made an important discovery, they board the mothership in order to steal the research data.

You are Elithios, a member of the research team. You have the only copy of the research data, and you must get it out before the pirates find you. In order to leave the mothership, you must find the three activation codes of the shuttle bay door.

The game is a classic arcade adventure game. You must explore screen after screen while avoiding enemies and the many traps (mines, explosive cyborgs, flame-shooting pipes...). You start the game unarmed but you can collect ammunition for your weapon.

121507.name: The Rustbelt
121507.description:
Subtitle: tales of tenacity, depravity, and hope

From the RPG description here on RPGGeek:
Life here is nasty, brutish, and short. The Rust slowly eats everything away. It wears a man down. Corrodes him. Changes him. Makes him do things he wouldn't think himself capable of. If you had to, wouldn't you?

It's a hard world, and you gotta pay for what you want. Sometimes the price is so hideous it makes you think twice, but it might be your only chance. The Rust whispers in your ear, "C'mon, do the math."

So, how much are you willing to pay? What are you willing to do? What are you willing to become?

You gotta go a long way in the 'Belt to find a good man.

THE RUSTBELT is a post-apocalyptic roleplaying game featuring:

The Blood, Sweat, & Tears Engine: a flexible and easy-to-use resolution system in which your resolve matters more than your abilities.
The Psyche System: personality mechanics that keep the characters psychologically and emotionally realistic and compelling - no matter how inhuman they turn out to be - without taking away the player's control.
Player-authored stories: your characters will be pushed against the wall until they've revealed all their most monstrous and most admirable qualities, but the decisions are always yours to make, and the prices yours to pay. The end result is a gritty, desperate tale in the vein of The Stand, The Road, or Mad Max.
Customization support: full guidelines for adapting the game to other settings, as well as three examples to get you started.

121508.name: Bouldeur
121508.description:
User Summary

A Boulder Dash clone, with 72 levels and a level editor.

121509.name: Duel (1987)
121509.description:
User Summary

A budget arcade game for two players only. Each player controls a gunslinger on one side of the screen and must shoot the other while dodging bullets. Fixed obstacles can be used as cover, and a train sometimes moves across the screen, providing additional cover.

121510.name: Merlin
121510.description:
User Summary

An arcade-adventure game heavily inspired by Sorcery. You must explore the many screens of the kingdom of Merlin and collect objects, while avoiding the monsters who drain your energy.

121511.name: Pac Punk
121511.description:
User Summary

A Pacman clone in which Pacman sports a mohawk, ghosts are replaced by cops, and enemies can be shot after picking up one of the bonus guns.

121512.name: Synchronous
121512.description:
User Summary

A budget Breakout clone. The only additional feature is a timer, which gives additional points to the player depending on how fast a level is completed.

121513.name: Dogfight 2187
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121513.description:
User Summary

A wireframe 3D space shooter, using a split-screen to allow two players at the same time (either cooperatively or one against the other). The back of the box says:

"SPLIT SCREEN SIMULTANEOUS INTERACTIVE COMBAT WITH VIEWS FROM EACH PLAYER'S CRAFT.

In the 22nd Century, a grave crisis faces the free universe. A hole in the space time continuum has allowed hordes of marauding alien invaders access to our universe, and now, only one man stands between them and us... RHETT DEXTER! in DOGFIGHT 2187, you are Dexter, and must search the heavens for the pieces of the Spatial Generator. These pieces were left by the Old Ones, which when assembled, will seal the breach. But between you and the generator stand untold numbers of deadly alien craft intend on one purpose only... preventing you from sealing the hole in space... thus insuring their inevitable victory and total domination of the Free Universe."

121514.name: Skulduggery
121514.description:
User Summary

An arcade adventure game. The game manual says:
"As Zenit the Magician, you must search for the lost apprentice who foolishly strayed into the Evil One's castle."

121515.name: Vampire Killer (CPC)
121515.description:
User Summary

An arcade adventure game, in which you must reach the 12th floor of a building and kill the vampire who dwells there.

The game manual says:

""A vampire you say, in the flat above you, keeps you up all night you say, no it's no trouble I'll be there before you can say Lycanthrope". And so the race is on, it's nearly midnight and you reach the bottom of the building, but you've forgotten all your equipment, no time you have to find some on the way up, because if you don't kill that vampire before midnight then you're going to be working night shifts too."

121516.name: Book of Eldritch Might II: Songs and Souls of Power (First Edition)
121516.description:
From Introduction:

Malhavoc is the only known mortal arcanist to have “possessed” The Book of Eldritch Might — if one can use such a term for an object that may have been an elder god trapped in the form of a tome—for any significant amount of time. We at Malhavoc Press presented much of what he found as a book of the same name, but it was only a smattering of the knowledge that the actual source contained. This new volume, Book of Eldritch Might II: Songs and Souls of Power, offers further arcane secrets and mysterious lore: classes, feats, spells, magical items, monsters, and more.

121517.name: The Book of Eldritch Might (First Edition)
121517.description:
From Introduction:

Malhavoc was an arrogant bastard, but his ideas were interesting. Arcane spellcasters — arcanists — do possess the unique attributes to call power into themselves, serving only their own wishes. Of course, this led to the development of their not-entirelyundeserved reputation of evil, power-mad egoism.

Wizards, sorcerers, and bards are formidable characters who command great power. But power is only as great as the knowledge behind it. Much of the secret arcanist lore lies within the covers of a massive tome known as The Book of Eldritch Might. This volume holds just a small sampling of the treasures found in those pages. Frequently, in fact, snippets such as this one are copied from the book and disseminated as books of magic all their own.

Malhavoc himself, a powerful wizard, claimed to have possessed the full Book of Eldritch Might for a time. He said the book was intelligent — an elder god of magic somehow trapped within a simple item. In his “conversations” with the book, he transcribed details of new areas of study, new spells, new magical items, and more. We are proud to present his work.

121519.name: Demon God's Fane (First Edition)
121519.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the back of the module:

"The Demon God"...

A name so old and so obscure, most people no longer remember the terror it conceals. Now, something evil has slithered its way into the village of GOlden Lake, and into the minds and souls of the villagers. Has the old temple to the demon prince Ochremeshk become a threat again after so many centures? And how can it be stopped when its location remains lost in plain sight?

The cultists of the demon god are out to get you. Track them down and wipe them out in tehir own lair in this challenging d20 adventure for 14th and 15th-level cahracters. Demon God's Fane serves as a companion to the popular The Book of Eldritch Might, featuring many of that sourcebook's high magic prestige classes, feats, spells, magic items, and more.

NOTE: While Demon God's Fane uses much information from The Book of Eldritch Might (First Edition), it does include suggestions on conversion for those who do not own that book.

121520.name: Pirate Hunter
121520.description:
Pirate Hunter is a push-your-luck dice and card game with opportunities for player interaction. Players compete to capture pirates by rolling dice against a challenge number shown on each pirate card.
Players must manage their dice pool carefully while taking just enough risk to stay ahead of the others.

The more pirates a player captures, the more risk their dice will be lost to Davy Jones along with the plunder accumulated that round.

Some rolls give dice, some rolls send dice to Davy Jones! In a pinch, players may call for the aid of another player and then negotiate a settlement for the assistance. But be careful, those lending aid are also putting their dice at risk.

Will you keep your plunder in your hold and risk the roll with fewer dice or use it to buy back dice and risk not having enough plunder to win in the end?

121521.name: Greyhound Race Game
121521.description:
Box slogan "Exciting Game For All the Family,With All the Thrills of the Track."

The object of the game is to get your greyhound first over the finish line.

Choose your trap number, choose your stake and on which dog you wish to bet on. Fany bets such as Forecasts or Combinations are allowed (although heaven knows what a 7 year old would make of that).

When you land on the special spaces, most tell you to draw a card and follow the instructions. There are good and bad cards draw. Some cards relate to bonuses, reserve dogs, competitive greyhounds, and sprint racing are all part of the game.

121522.name: WordHound
121522.description:
The Game of WordHound is played by two to four players. The Object of the game is to make an answer belonging to the category in play from the letters on your letter rack.

During your turn you draw letters from the letter bag, one at a time, until you draw a letter you want to keep. When you keep a letter, your turn is over and you pass the bag to the player on your left. Letters you don't want are placed face up on the letter board where they may be taken by other players. Letters you keep are placed on your letter rack.

The first player to make an answer using all the letters on his or her rack wins the round. The winner scores two points for each letter in his or her answer, plus a bonus equal to the number of the round being played. Other players score one point for each letter in their partial answer if every letter on their rack is used in the partial answer. Players score zero points if there are any unused letters on their rack when the round ends.

An answer may consist of one or more words and may be singular or plural. Blank tiles may be used as any letter and are scored as a letter. Spaces between words and other punctuation are assumed and do not affect scoring.

The player with the highest score after six rounds of play wins the game.

121523.name: Desert Island Game
121523.description:
Promotional game published by J S Fry & Sons, a leading manufacturer of chocolate at this time (most famous for the TV adverts for "Fry's Turkish Delight).

A basic roll and move game. The board track covers 'Setting Sail' and ends on the desert island and safety. Obey instructions if you land on special squares. First to arrive at the end of the track, wins.

The game was despatched as a flat-pack, so you had to provide your own playing pieces and dice.

121524.name: Fairground Game
121524.description:
Promotional game published by J S Fry & Sons, a leading manufacturer of chocolate at this time (most famous for the TV adverts for "Fry's Turkish Delight).

A basic roll and move game, taking ideas from Ludo in some places. Each player has four men and their designated start point. The board track covers various encounters with fairground attractions. When you land on one, you must follow the instructions. If you land on another player's piece, that piece is sent back to the start.

First to get all four pices home, wins.

The game was despatched as a flat-pack, so you had to provide your own playing pieces and dice.

121525.name: Jungle Game
121525.description:
Promotional game published by J S Fry & Sons, a leading manufacturer of chocolate at this time (most famous for the TV adverts for "Fry's Turkish Delight).

A basic roll and move game. The board track covers the Expedition Start and ends at the expedition end, where a boat awaits your arrival. Obey instructions if you land on special squares. First to arrive at the end of the track, wins.

The game was despatched as a flat-pack, so you had to provide your own playing pieces and dice.

121526.name: Spot-A-Lott
121526.description:
Game for children to play on long car journeys. The board is magnetic, especially important because the game is intended to be played in a moving car.

Cards provide the things to spot and you can score from 1 to 6 points depending on the rarity of the thing to spot. As you score points, you move your player marker along the track. The one who is furthest up the track, wins.

121527.name: Spintops
121527.description:
"A Game for Everyone".

The board has a number of holes in it, of varying sizes. In a turn, the player sets off his spinning top in the start area, with the intention of sending it forward towards the scoring holes. If it falls into a hole, points are scored. It follows that the bigger the hole, the less points are gained.

First to reach a pre-agreed total of points, wins.

121528.name: One Night Only
121528.description: One Night Only is a game for 3 to 5 players who each take the role of a Band in their humble beginnings and guide them to the heights of Fame. Players choose actions to increase of Band's confidence so they will be able to play larger and larger gigs - thus gathering more and more Fame (and Money). Next they will bid Cash to hire a Bookie who will use his prestige to get the Bands gigs. Players can even play gigs together as Headliner and Opener. At the end of the game, whoever has the highest Fame, is the Winner!

121529.description:
This is a set of supplemental weapon cards that were initially created for overfunding goals of the original "Gunship: First Strike!" kickstarter campaign.

Whether you want to increase your offence (with some Homing Missiles), or your looking for something a little more defensive, (like the Defense Turret), these powerful new weapons add a little more variety to your choices when designing your ship. Just place the X-perimental weapons on your ship like any weapon from the base game and enjoy countless new strategies!
boardgameversion: Escape Pod Games Kickstarter Exclusive Edition
121529.name: Gunship: First Strike! X-perimental Weapons

121530.name: The British Empire
121530.description:
Patriotic card game, made when Britain actually had an Empire but one that was fading fast.

The objective is to gain certain cards to complete sets. The different feature as that the sets have a differing number of cards within them. For example, to collect Ireland cards, you will need 4 cards to complete the set. But to collect England & Wales cards, you would need 6 cards to complete the set.

When all the possible sets have been collected, the one with the most sets wins.

121531.description:
Gunship: Asteroids! adds a new "terrain" to your BattleSpace, the Asteroid Field!

You and your Battle Group have a new Objective: In addition to the usual combat with enemy forces, you are ordered to enter the deadly Asteroid Field and retrieve the ones that contain X-Plodium, an ore vital to the weapon industry. Your goal is to be the first team to fill the hangar of your Carrier and make the jump to Hyperspace. As usual, your opponent has the same mission! Dodge giant flying rocks, fend off the enemy's attacks, grab the prize and make it out alive - easier said than done!
121531.name: Gunship: Asteroids!

121532.description: Gunship: Crewmates! is an expansion featuring crewmates designed by 18 lucky backers of the original kickstarter campagin. These new recruits will enter your game and add their skills to your battles. But watch out, the Gunship universe is a very dangerous place and Crewmates don't last forever. If you lose a ship carrying a Crewmate in Campaign Play, you can never use them again! Never fear - there will always be new recruits to take their place, or you COULD skip this rule when we're not looking...
121532.name: Gunship: Crewmates!

121533.name: Oggle Boggle
121533.description:
Very strange game and nothing to do with the more famous Boggle game.

Place the heads on a smooth surface and put an eye-ball in each socket, making sure that the pupils do not show. All players then place a fly disc on their cards in an agreed position, say, at the top of the head. Players then proceed to align the eyes on the fly by moving the card about In any direction or by rotating It. The first to achieve the alignment then decides where all players shall next place the fly. The eyes remain in the position achieved at the end of the first round. The player who is first 3 times is the winner.

121534.name: The Handicap Race Game
121534.description:
Tin-plate game. It consists of a spinner with eight unequal areas. Each area is assigned to a horse and the bigger the are allocated, the shorter the odds for that horse.

Players just place their bets and spin the spinner. After the result, pay the winners and take in the losing bets.

I suspect that it was assumed that you would use counters as the 'money' and the one with the most counters after an agreed number of races, wins.

I can see no reason why adults might play this by using real money instead of counters.

121535.name: Leap-O
121535.description:
Action game. Each player has three balls that must be loaded into a spring-like device, one at a time. If you press down on the device and then let go, the ball will fly out, hopefully towards the board. On the board are 9 squares, each square having a point value. Furthermore, each square has a fixed ring and the ball must stay within a ring to score. The scores range from 5 to 30 points.

First to reach a pre-agreed total score, wins.

121536.name: Knock Your Block Off
121536.description:
Players build up a wall with many blocks in it. On their turn, they must knock out one block from the wall with the glove end of their bodger. The spinner determines the colour to go but the player chooses which particular block of that colour they want to try to remove.

The first player to dislodge any of their yellow blocks, loses the game.

121537.name: The Vehicle Handbook
121537.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Completely rewritten with an all new flexible and easy to get to grips with design system, the Vehicle Handbook is a central resource for the Traveller RPG. As well as providing details of every vehicle published for the Traveller RPG, along with many new designs, the Vehicle Handbook also contains a complete construction system allowing you to build any vehicle in any setting, from a simple bicycle to advanced power armour, from a floating aircraft carrier to a massive piloted robot. The vehicle Handbook is designed to become an integral part of the Traveller RPG.

121538.name: The NeXus Files
121538.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In May 2003, Jonny Nexus embarked on a journey that would take him from the ruins of post-WWIII Poland to the shores of long-gone realms, and from the faded grandeur of 1920s Venice to the twice-sunned deserts of alien worlds. During this journey he would view fabulous sights, witness epoch-shattering events, and meet beings of both might and majesty – many of whom he then proceeded to kill. He engaged millennia old vampires in hand-to-hand combat armed only with petrol bombs and a ready wit. He uncovered secrets of ages past; he forgot secrets of ages past. He robbed from those that had money, and kept it. Across a score of glittering worlds he entirely failed to write himself into either myth or legend.
But he did have fun.
And somewhere along the way he even found time to die.
Several times.
For thirty months, Jonny Nexus recorded the thoughts aroused by, and the lessons learned from, his twice-weekly roleplaying habit in a column he wrote for Mongoose Publishing's Signs & Portents magazine. Part travelogue, part guide, part manual, and part manifesto, these are those columns.

121539.name: Flashbacks Redux Redux
121539.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The most popular XP-edition missions are back, in their 25th Anniversary guise! Filled with hand-picked classic adventures from all previous editions of Paranoia, Flashbacks Redux Redux is gaming hilarity at its greatest. This is the second compilation of classic Paranoia missions, and should not be missed!
These and many other classics are found in Flashbacks Redux Redux, all suitable trimmed, tweaked and tailored for the latest edition of Paranoia: Troubleshooters.
The full range of missions include;
Spin Control
Citizens' Guide to Surviving Alpha Complex
My First Treason
Sweep of Unhistory
The Communist Cafeteria Conspiracy
Viva la Revolution
The Peoples' Glorious Revolution
Comes with a free copy of Materials Treacherously Deleted, containing oodles mroe Bonus Fun!

121540.name: Spelka
121540.description:
Rare word game from around the turn of the 20th century. Devised at a "Famous London Literary Club", it was probably a new idea over 100 years ago.

52 cards all feature letters, each with a value that relates to the rarity of the letter in the English language (For example, an E would be 4, a Q would be 1, and so on). This value is important because if a player goes out whilst you still hold cards, then you give him the score of you unused cards - i.e. you are not penalised much for holding 'difficult' letters but you are if you hold common letters.

The game mechanic is simple. In a turn a player may lay as many cards as he wants but he must always have in mind a genuine word that could be spelt out eventually. For example, you might lay an L. The next player lays a T after the L (he is thinking of SALT). The next player might lay an I and an M after the T (he is thinking of ULTIMATE) and so on, until a player is challenged that there can be no such word with that array of letters (By the way, the letters must stay in the order they are laid, there is no rearranging letters). If challenged, a player must prove that he was thinking of a word, and if proven true, he receives payment (counters) from the others. If he was bluffing, he pays out counters to the persoin who challenged him.

When the game time is finished, the one with the most counters, wins.

By the way, in 1900 or so, they must have been aware of Analysis Paralysis because there is a fixed rule 'If you take longer than 30 seconds to play or pass, you forfeit your turn and must draw an extra card into your hand'.
And another oddity, how often are you told to enjoy your game - in Latin? The phrase Experientia Docet!, is used at the end of the rules

121542.name: Seeker
121542.description:
From the PDF:
Seeker is a role-playing game of wandering mystics and philosophers on the back roads of the rural US.

A complete role playing game. No other products needed to play.
Uses ORC-L, the lite version of Organic Rule Components, designed for quick character creation and light or live action play.
Play PCs from any background, tradition or philosophical viewpoint.
Each character approaches enlightenment, self-improvement or wisdom in their own unique way, and each gains unique abilities from it.
Contains "Weaponized Honeybees," a complete introductory adventure.
Although Seekers’ adventures may take them anywhere, extensive information is given on small-town America and the secrets and dangers one may find there.

121543.name: Magicka Collection
121543.description:
Magicka is a satirical action-adventure game set in a rich fantasy world based on Norse mythology. The player assumes the role of a wizard from a sacred order tasked with stopping an evil sorcerer who has thrown the world into turmoil, his foul creations besieging the forces of good.

Players will be able to combine elements to cast spells, wreaking havoc and devastation on the minions of darkness. They will also be able to team up with friends and fight their way through the campaign, or test their skills in the magickal arts through other challenging modes.

In the challenge mode, players fight off waves of enemies to earn their place on local and online leaderboards.

Included within the Magicka Collection are:


Magicka
Magicka Vietnam
Magicka Wizard Survival Kit
Magicka Caverns and Marshlands
Magicka Nippon
Magicka FInal Frontier
Magicka Frozen Lake
Magicka Watch Tower
Magicka Robe Bundle


Source: The Publisher Website.

Microbadges

Magicka fan
Magicka fan - Arcane
Magicka fan - Water
Magicka fan - Cold
Magicka fan - Earth
Magicka fan - Fire
Magicka fan - Life
Magicka fan - Lightning
Magicka fan - Shield

121544.name: Common Criminals: Pilot-Promo
121544.description:
From publisher blurb:

Common Criminals is the new planned series of modern/near future role playing supplements from Fishwife Games. Unlike many products that feature spandex clad super villains, cybernetic punks, or pale faced modern vampires, Common Criminals showcases a variety of interesting but otherwise "everyday" criminals. Each regular addition of Common Criminals will feature six different criminals along with detailed information. In addition to basic information, the products will list a set of character attributes to aid the Game Master (GM) in the conversion of the characters to the role playing game of the GM's choice.

This product has been provided for free to give the gaming public a chance to see what is to be offered in the upcoming series. In addition to this promotional product, an upcoming [Common Criminals: Companion Guide] will also be released as a free pdf. The companion guide will contain information on character conversion, including a more detailed explanation of the presented attribute system as well as tips on how the GM can incorporate the characters into a variety of different settings.

121545.description:
In Shadow Agent, inspired by video games like Splinter Cell and Metal Gear Solid, the players take on the role of shadow agents from a non-specified secret agency, with the goal of infiltrating an enemy location (base or mansion) to accomplish a certain mission. The agents must not be seen or heard by the numerous guards walking around the location, so they must hide among the shadows, hide behind walls and furniture, and hit the enemies from behind, being silent the whole time.

At the start of the game, each player chooses up to five items to help with the current mission. Each turn, the active player rolls the action dice and performs two of the rolled actions, which can be Move, Shoot, Melee Attack and Heal. In addition, one die can be replaced by a free action, which range from using an enemy as a meatshield, to interacting with locations, to hiding the corpse of a dead guard.

After a player performs his two actions, the guards – which come in three types: green, yellow and red – are activated. For each type of guard, one player rolls a die twice, with all the guards of this type then performing the rolled actions in order. Actions range from moving 1-4 areas, to shooting, to calling for help (which will spawn other guards). In more detail:


Green guards move, shoot, and spawn other guards at an average rate.
Yellow guards shoot and spawn other guards a lot.
Red guards shoot a lot and move very quickly.


As soon as an alarm sounds due to a guard spotting a dead guard's corpse, all guards are activated with the red die, so things become much tougher for the player agents.
121545.name: Shadow Agent

121546.name: Common Criminals: Companion Guide
121546.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mean streets are full of criminals from all walks of life. Some have taken up crime as purely as a means of survival while others simply choose to get ahead in life by breaking the rules. Regardless of their situations in life, all these individuals have one thing in common. They have become outlaws.

Common Criminals is a new series of system generic products from Fishwife Games. Rather than exploring characters with supernatural abilities, powerful mutations, or access to larger than life technology, focus is placed upon criminal characters from a more realistic perspective. While the characters provided in the series are fictional products of the author's imagination, the criminals are presented in a manner that makes them more believable. In other words, beyond made up names and background details there is little difference between the presented characters and real life modern outlaws.

While the intended setting for Common Criminals is modern day times, the criminals can be easily ported over to near dark future settings. Likewise, these supplements are fine additions to more cinematic settings, such as the super hero genre.

The current intended location for Common Criminals is the United States of America. As Fishwife Games has a strong customer support base in Europe and other parts of the world, there are planned future spin offs that focuses on the criminal element of other parts of the world.

This guide was created for the purpose of providing a freely available source book for assisting Game Masters in the conversion of other Common Criminals products into pre-existing games. In an effort to maximize the information provide in the Common Criminals supplements to fullest potential while still maintaining a system generic standpoint, the author of the Common Criminals series decided upon creating a separate conversion guide. In the interest of satisfying customer needs, it was determined that this guide should be freely available for download. Likewise, the information should be simple as possible while still offering a great deal of flexibility.

121547.name: Common Criminals: Series 1
121547.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mean streets are full of criminals from all walks of life. Some have taken up crime as purely as a means of survival while others simply choose to get ahead in life by breaking the rules. Regardless of their situations in life, all these individuals have one thing in common. They have become outlaws.

This first series of Common Criminals features background information for six different crooks and thugs. Nature of crimes range from drug dealing to prostitution to money laundering. Although much of the information presented in this modern gaming supplement is self explanatory, having a copy of [Common Criminals: Companion Guide] never hurts. This is especially true when using the attribute score points to convert characters over to the game system of your choice.

121548.name: Common Criminals: Series 2
121548.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mean streets are full of criminals from all walks of life. Some have taken up crime as purely as a means of survival while others simply choose to get ahead in life by breaking the rules. Regardless of their situations in life, all these individuals have one thing in common. They have become outlaws.

This second series of Common Criminals features background information for six different crooks and thugs. Nature of crimes range from drug dealing to pimping to chop shops. Although much of the information presented in this modern gaming supplement is self explanatory, having a copy of [Common Criminals: Companion Guide] never hurts. This is especially true when using the attribute score points to convert characters over to the game system of your choice.

In this edition of Common Criminals, you'll meet the following individuals...

Marcus Clark: A used car sales man with a clandestine chop shop on the outskirts of town.
Conrad McGrath: A white collar criminal with a penchant for insider trading and illegal imports.
Freeway Jones: A pimp that takes special pride in his flamboyance and nature of living.
Clarence Jagger: A local musician that can sell you a little something extra to take your blues away.
Ronnie Boulder: An ex-pro wrestler turned criminal enforcer.
Aaron Edwards: A white supremacist that deals in meth in order to bring in profits for "the cause".

121550.name: Back Streets
121550.description:
From Introduction:

Back Streets RPG takes place in the dark and dirty parts of the city.

The hidden reality
The setting is the real world, but the part of the real world that is hidden away from most people.

The night
The people of Back Streets RPG move in the hidden parts of the city, and they do it at night.

Players take on classic roles like police officers, mafia members or reporters.

The game contains a complete system of rules and a short introduction scenario.

121551.name: Hex Vestige
121551.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is the future. Super-science, space ships and aliens. Rare individuals wield magical forces, making them super-human. This setting for MasterBook includes new rules and an adventure.

It is a hundred years or so into the future. Super-scientists build amazing technology.   Mankind builds space ships and travels in space, encountering alien life and ruins of ancient civilizations.

Ancient artifacts defy classification as science or magic. Unexplainable forces linger in areas of space.  Rare individuals wield powerful magical forces without the use of any technology, making them super-human.

This setting was designed for and  requires the  universal roleplaying game rules system MasterBook. Included here are new rules for space ship combat, super-science and magic. A first adventure also lets the characters stumble across ancient artifacts, alien monsters, and a secret organisation.

121552.name: Raxath'Viz, the Creeping Rot
121552.description:
From publisher blurb:

RAXATH'VIZ, THE CREEPING ROT - CR 15, Male Kobold (Black Bloodline), Cleric (Hidden Priest) 10, Divine Scion 3, Rogue (Trapsmith) 3

Spreading the diseased will of his doomed goddess, the cunning kobold known as Raxath’Vis, the Creeping Rot, slinks throughout the land creeping like the cold darkness of a winter’s dusk. Death follows like a black cloud, the ravens and vultures in tow, foretell of the return of Maramaga, Queen of Rot, and her dark machinations. When cities and towns lie still, with naught heard but the buzzing of insects and the screams of carrion birds, you can rest assured that the Creeping Rot hath come calling.

Infamous Adversaries contains: one ready to use villain, complete with equipment, a rich background including motives, history, personality, network, resources, lair, tactics, morale, advancement options, a quote, plot hooks to easily insert them into your campaign, local lore, full color art and a vibrant description. The Infamous Adversaries characters are designed to challenge an entire party; not just in combat, but also through less direct methods requiring careful planning and confrontation.

Contained within is 25 pages of original TPK content including a full depiction of our Infamous Adversary, plus original short fiction, a new deity and faction, several supporting cast characters and monsters, plus our personally designed Hero Lab files for use in customizing our characters and content in your campaigns!

121553.name: Temerlyth the Undying
121553.description:
From publisher blurb:

TEMERLYTH THE UNDYING - CR 16, Male Lich Alchemist 6, Loremaster 3, Wizard (Enchanter) 6

Temerlyth is one of those rarest of beings, an elven lich. Drinking from the cup of blackest hate, ancient wrath drives him ever on. Accompanied by his ravenous undead children, his tormented wife and her former lover, Temerlyth is a powerful horror stalking the broken ends of the world just as easily as right outside your door. He searches for the next victim of his vile experiments. He inspires nightmare whispers, tales told in the dark and seedy places where adventurers gather to swap stories sane men would rather not hear, stories that just may prove all too real!

The world is filled with colorful characters of many hues. Not all within subscribe to black or white; many are shades of grey. Infamous Adversaries characters, by TPK Games, shows you villains in their true light - insidious. These are not merely NPCs to fill your game; they are villains in the truest sense of the word, complete with stories that don't just tell the character's tale, but enrich your game. Our adversaries are not villains because they have evil alignments; they are villains because your players will despise them!

Infamous Adversaries contains: one ready to use villain, complete with equipment, a rich background including motives, history, personality, network, resources, lair, tactics, morale, advancement options, a quote, plot hooks to easily insert them into your campaign, local lore, full color art and a vibrant description. The Infamous Adversaries characters are designed to challenge an entire party; not just in combat, but also through less direct methods requiring careful planning and confrontation.

This Infamous Adversary sourcebook contains Temerlyth the Undying, an elven alchemist/wizard that made the ultimate sacrifice for his people, and in the end succumbed to his own madness. Also included is a new open content 5th level spell: Silvermist.

121554.name: The Sinister Secrets of Silvermote
121554.description:
From publisher blurb:

A hellish 64 page dungeon crawl designed for the Pathfinder RPG and scales for characters of 7th-12th level--an adventure not for the faint of heart! This is the first ever full-length adventure by Total Party Kill Games!

The setting of this adventure is a place called Silvermote, the underground lair of our latest villain in the Infamous Adversary product line, [Temerlyth the Undying]. You do not need the latter product to enjoy this one, but owning both will enhance your enjoyment immensely!

Temerlyth, our infamous elven lich, was forced to spend his great personal fortune and energies building what has become a hidden lair, laboratory and base of operations. He built it during a downward spiral of frustration, bitterness, spite, hatred and, finally, insanity-all of which drove him to seek lichdom. Silvermote is a calamitous reflection of his nature and more. This bizarre place features elements reminiscent of cathedrals, crypts and laboratories built over about a decade as Temerlyth, a once gifted alchemist and enchanter, went slowly mad and turned to dark necromancy in seeking a lasting solution against all werekind. Silvermote is a strange place from a lost age and has grown at least as twisted as its undead owner and just as filled with ancient spite and untold secrets.

The Sinister Secrets of Silvermote is part adventure, part recurring campaign location, all written especially for the Pathfinder RPG. The adventure features an unhealthy mixture of lycanthropy, undead, traps, tricks, new magic items and much, much more, including rules for making intricate magical tomes, locked, trapped and ready to fill a library of rewards!

This adventure can be dropped into any campaign setting as a hyper-challenging one-shot adventure or as a recurring adventure site to which defeated characters might return again and again!

This 64-page adventure features high-quality art, a detailed, full-color map of Silvermote (viewable in the teaser!) and uses the Open Game License to work with the Pathfinder RPG rules. It also features full hyperlinks to the award-wining D20PFSRD web site so everything you need online is right at your fingertips!

121555.name: Seven Samurai 20XX
121555.description:
Seven Samurai 20XX (20XX 七人の侍 20XX: Shichinin no Samurai) is based upon Akira Kurosawa's 1954 movie Seven Samurai. Rights for the production of the game were given by the Kurosawa production, with character designs by French artist Mœbius and the composition of the music by Ryuichi Sakamoto.

Seven Samurai 20XX is a re-telling of Seven Samurai in a futuristic setting. It takes various liberties with the original story to better suit the post setting and introduces anime and modern styled designs. The game follows seven samurai as they fight off an immense army of mutants, cyborgs and other inhuman creatures in an attempt to bring about a regime of peace for those in need. The player takes the role of Natoe, a samurai warrior, and is sent through various locations of post-Japan to fight off hundreds of enemies with a twin-sworded fighting style known as Nitou-Ryu. And while the story is based on the film Seven Samurai, its story and plot have more in common with its animated counterpart, Samurai 7.

The year is 20XX and the setting is Japan. Humans and Humanoids, the latter being various mutants, cyborgs, and robots, maintain a delicate balance in a large, unnamed city (somewhat resembling a post-apocalyptic Tokyo) where the power and balance of the city is maintained by a large structure known as the Steeple of light. Its source of power is a young girl named the Child of Heaven. When the child is stolen by the humanoids in order to break the balance and initiate war, the child then goes missing from her inhuman captors and is held by several villagers to ransom the city for money. When the humanoids and various Agents of the city set out to retrieve her and her Sacred Jewel, the villagers quickly find themselves in danger and look for Samurai (known in the game as "hunters") to protect them.

Seven Samurai 20XX is a hack and slash video game, as the protagonist of the game is faced with the task of destroying overwhelming hordes of enemies with his swords. Like many others of its genre, it utilizes a combo system, showing the player how many uninterrupted hits they have inflicted upon their opponents.

The main point of the game is to constantly utilize the second sword which is carried in the protagonist's shealth, allowing the player to achieve a larger combo score. Skill-related battle commands such as the Nitou-Ryu mode which allows the player to wield a second katana for a limited time, increase the speed, range and power of the players combos.

Nitou-Ryu mode is a duration of time engaged when the player presses the L1 and R1 triggers on the PlayStation 2 controller. It permits the protagonist to use a second blade for a limited amount of time to increase attack power and range of the weapons. As the player progresses in the game, the length of the bar can be increased.

A Just guard allows the player to deflect an enemy's attack with skillfully timed uses of the triangle button. It allows the player to avoid damage and generates a counter-attack opportunity. This move also fully refills the Nitou-Ryu timer to 100% of its capacity.

A Just Step is executed with proper timing of the X button and allows the player to avoid an enemy's attack and "step" (in game, it looks more akin to a teleport) behind the enemy for a counter-attack. This move partially refills the Nitou-Ryu timer. An Just attack allows Natoe to travel in the direction of one or more enemies at great speed, breaking their defense. This move also partially refills the Nitou-Ryu meter. The game also incorporates various Street Fighter-like combos and "Charge attacks" which occur when holding the square button at various combos and when dashing with the X button.

Source: Wikipedia, "Seven Samurai 20XX", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121556.name: The Love of Money
121556.description:
From publisher blurb:

Six months ago, Ordo Veritatis agent John Sheldon went off the organisations radar following an emotional breakdown in the wake of loosing his wife in a car crash. He held is sister, fellow Ordo Veritatis agent Caroline Sheldon responsible for her death as she was drunk at the wheel that night. Psychiatric Metrics feared John went out to perform a solo mission to expose the heart of an Esoterrorist funding network he had uncovered in Amsterdam. The proposal for that mission had been shelved months ago due to its low probability of success.

When his body turns up in Amsterdam, evidently the sacrifice in an Esoterrorist ritual, the eye of suspicion turns on the rest of his team he left behind. Are they guilty by mere association, or are they innocent of his fate? They are given a chance to find out what happened to their friend and colleague, and in the process clear them from any suspicion in the eyes of the Ordo Veritatis.

The Love of Money is an Esoterrorists adventure for 4-6 players from incredible GM and Pelgrane Crew favourite, Matthew Sanderson. It is designed as a single stand-alone adventure with pre-generated characters provided, but can be tweaked to accommodate integration into an ongoing campaign.

121557.name: Shadow Man: 2econd Coming
121557.description:
Shadow Man: 2econd Coming is loosely based on the Shadowman comic book series published by Valiant Comics. It is the sequel to the 1999 video game, Shadow Man.

Like the first Shadow Man title, the game features a dark and mystical atmosphere that also has a distinctly Cajun feel to it. In addition to the storyline being set largely in or around New Orleans, the game is filled with themes of death, voodoo, Creole characters and names, as well as elements of African spirituality. The game follows protagonist Mike LeRoi in his quest to protect the living from otherworldly forces as part of his responsibility as the Shadow Man—which he became after being given (by the voodoo priestess, Mama Nettie) an ancient artifact called the Mask of Shadows, which gives the wearer the ability to traverse the worlds of the living and the dead.

The story begins as Mike LeRoi resurrects from "Deadside" to "Liveside" in order to contact Jaunty, a human-headed snake and a close associate of Mama Nettie. Unfortunately, after LeRoi finds and returns Jaunty to Mama Nettie, he is cursed with a powerful spell. Upon completion of his second task and after another encounter with Mama Nettie, LeRoi receives a note from a man named Thomas Deacon whom he goes about in search of, after which LeRoi learns of Asmodeus and the Grigori, as well as their plan to cause Armageddon. It is once again up to Mike LeRoi, or Shadow Man, to save the world.

Acclaim found themselves in a bit of a controversy, when plans of advertising the title on small billboards on tombstones were announced, saying the would pay relatives for the advertising, adding that "poorer" families might be especially interested. They also said "It's a dark, gory type of game and we thought it was appropriate to raise advertising to a new level."

Source: Wikipedia, "Shadow Man: 2econd Coming", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121558.name: The Cave Of Stars
121558.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cave of Stars takes it's name from the mosaic ceilings which the Orcs put in place to honour their dark gods. This simple temple acts a a centre of worship for a number of local tribal groups.

Each 1SD product provides you with a map, using a standard 5ftx5ft square grid, which is suitable for a single session of dungeon-based play and ideal for filling in gaps in your campaign or for stringing together with two or three other maps to create a larger scenario.

Simple Fantasy dungeon data is provided, making the maps more useful to GMs running that game, but the map is unpopulated and no specific game mechanics are included so that any 1SD product can be used with any role-playing game.

What you don’t get is the specific room descriptions, background and scenario notes which which are found in a full scenario. You also don’t get any monsters, traps or other specific hazards.

What you do get is a simple map and some basic data that can help kick-start your own creative processes. The idea is for you to populate the dungeon according to your own needs and desires, not for us to write you a scenario.

The 1SD range is designed as an aid to the GM in creating their own scenarios so that you end up with something better suited to your players and your game.

121559.name: Drakeslair Cave
121559.description:
From publisher blurb:

Draveslair Cave takes it's name from the Lesser Drake which drove out the original Orcish inhabitants. Now that the Drake has been slain the orcs have moved back in, only to find themselves under attack by the very adventurers who slew the beast.

Each 1SD product provides you with a map, using a standard 5ftx5ft square grid, which is suitable for a single session of dungeon-based play and ideal for filling in gaps in your campaign or for stringing together with two or three other maps to create a larger scenario.

Simple Fantasy dungeon data is provided, making the maps more useful to GMs running that game, but the map is unpopulated and no specific game mechanics are included so that any 1SD product can be used with any role-playing game.

What you don’t get is the specific room descriptions, background and scenario notes which which are found in a full scenario. You also don’t get any monsters, traps or other specific hazards.

What you do get is a simple map and some basic data that can help kick-start your own creative processes. The idea is for you to populate the dungeon according to your own needs and desires, not for us to write you a scenario.

The 1SD range is designed as an aid to the GM in creating their own scenarios so that you end up with something better suited to your players and your game.

121560.name: Shaman King: Spirit of Shamans
121560.description:
Shaman King: Spirit of Shamans is the first PlayStation game released within the popular Shaman King anime series. This time however, the game developmental team Dimps would take lead of the production. One of the last PlayStation games ever released, it was never available in a "The Best" version, making it very hard to find, especially a sealed copy.

In Shaman King: Spirit of Shamans, you will complete the first half of the overall story featured within the anime/manga series. This is the first fighting game featured within the series. The graphics seem to reflect other styles seen within the original Gundam Battle Assault, in which you will be playing right-to-left with advanced sprite graphics. Your spirit can also be regularly used within this fighter as to assist you.

At random times in battle, the icon of your specific spirit will flash, in which if you press either O or X fast enough, your overall spirit meter will rise. When risen to the highest extent, you can unleash your ultimate. Within this game, three different buttons vary from a weak attack, or a more stronger attack. The combo system seems to range up to the max of 10 in battle.

Story mode, Vs mode, and Arcade mode are the three playable modes within this game. In Story mode, you will experience various cutscenes and additional minigames. Arcade mode seems to be the same except for the fact that you will be continuously battling. Of course within Vs mode, you can battle against a friend or a com.

Overall within this game, 17 characters are playable (3 of which being different versions of Yoh).

Source: Wikipedia, "Shaman King: Spirit of Shamans", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Official site: (Japanese only)
http://www.bandaigames.channel.or.jp/list/shamanking/

121561.name: Shaman King: Funbari Spirits
121561.description:
Shaman King: Funbari Spirits, is a cel-shaded 2D style fighting game released in Japan only. It is not to be confused with Shaman King: Power of Spirit, a game produced by Konami to go along with the 4kids Entertainment dub. This is a pseudo-sequel to Shaman King: Spirit of Shamans, a 2D fighting game for the PlayStation. Interestingly, this game is based upon the Manga and is the very last Shaman King game to be released in Japan.

Funbari Spirits features simple controls and plays quite like a 2D fighter despite being 3D. There is a 2 player mode, adventure story mode, mini game mode, and a free play mode along with training mode. The game also has voices from the original anime, as well as colorful cel-shaded graphics.

All of the main characters are present as playable characters, along with a few exclusive-to-this-game-only characters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shaman King: Funbari Spirits", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Official publisher's web site:
http://www.bandaigames.channel.or.jp/list/shamanking_hun/

121562.name: 3D Voice Chess
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121562.description:
User Summary

A chess game using isometric 3d graphics and speech synthesis. The game has 7 levels of play, a problem solving mode, a comprehensive help menu, and an option to change sides with the computer opponent.

121563.name: Draughts/Checkers
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121563.description:
User Summary

A checkers game for 1 player. Includes several levels of play, and a problem-solving mode.

121564.name: Sabian Island
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121564.description:
User Summary

A top-down shooter in which you must battle enemy soldiers and tanks in order to recover parts of the only device capable of saving New York.

121565.name: Solar Warrior
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121565.description:
User Summary

A side-scrolling shoot'em up. The back of the box says:

"The only hope for mankind is in the hands of you, the only remaining Solar Warrior. You must defend Earth's supplies both in deep space and on the surface of our remaining territories."

121566.name: Big Screen Hero
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121566.description:
User Summary

A compilation of minigames (a pacman clone, a shoot'em up...) representing movies in which the protagonist is starring. The back of the box says:

"Fight your way through your roles as the Big Screen Hero to Hollywood, fame and fortune."

121567.name: Boxing Fighter
121567.description:
"Do you have what it takes to prove yourself in the ring? Train your fully customizable boxer to defeat over 100 different opponents and dominate the underground fight club scene!

Boxing Fighter is the first iPhone / iPod Touch Boxing game done in the classic styles of Street FighterTM and Mortal CombatTM, with beautiful landscape mode fights and massive special attacks!

With more moves, move opponents and more customization than any other boxing app out there, you’ll never need another app to get your smack down on!

Features:

Try yourself out on single fights, or go for the world title in the 100 bout career mode
Unlock four different locations from the Street Bar to the Death Match Club
Take your opponent to the ropes and win major title bouts to take home the belts!
Train your fighter in various techniques to help you beat the stronger fighters
Buy new gear for your boxer including training machines and enhanced equipment
Discover opponent shattering special moves including the lightning blast and fists of fury"

Source: The Game Website.

121568.name: Meurtres en Serie
121568.description:
User Summary

Third installment in Cobra Soft's "Meurtres" series of investigation games. The back of the box says (translated from French):

"After "Meurtre à grande vitesse" and "Meurtres sur l'Atlantique", COBRA SOFT introduces a new super-production: "MEURTRES EN SERIE".

1986. 40km away from the French coast, a small Anglo-French island is still a feudal kingdom... complete with a Lord, traditions and ancient customs!

These extraordinary surroundings form the background where the plot of "Meurtres en série", Bertrand Brocard's new murder mystery, unfolds.

Several stories are intertwined in this adventure: Celtic legends, treasure hunt, greed, madness... The player will have to uncover the truth behind the murders, but the task won't be over until the "Secret of the Monks" is revealed and the treasure discovered...

The game is played in real time, in surroundings modelled after the real island; and you'll have to live this "peculiar day" more than once.

Experience real adventure!

Not only you'll find real clues in the game box (a carved clay tablet, a parchment, a woman's stocking... overall more than 30 different items!), but COBRA SOFT goes even further!

One of the places in "Meurtres en série" exists. Come to Paris and you'll be able to explore it. And if you travel to the island of Sercq, you may even discover the "treasure"."

videogame: Hearts of Iron III: For the Motherland
Hearts of Iron III: Semper Fi
121569.name: Hearts of Iron III Collection
videogamecompilation: Hearts of Iron III: For the Motherland
Hearts of Iron III: Semper Fi
121569.description:
It’s time to dust off the field marshal's baton and take command of any nation in World War II; the largest conflict in history. The first expansion to the critically acclaimed Hearts of Iron III lets you take charge - or delegate - at any level, from division to nation, through a variety of scenarios.

Included within the Hearts of Iron III Collection are:
• Hearts of Iron III
• Hearts of Iron III Semper Fi expansion
• Hearts of Iron III For The Motherland expansion
• The complete Hearts of Iron III Spritepacks comprising of - German, US, Soviet, German Infantry, Japanese Infantry, Soviet Infantry, Soviet Music, German II, MegaGerman

Source: The Publisher Website.

121570.name: Charades !
121570.description:
"fabulous entertainment for you and your friends, for free and with no hidden costs! Forget tokens, berries, and other virtual currencies – download the game now, totally for free, and start having great fun!

Charades is a game for many players and is a challenge to your knowledge, speed, richness of associations, and manual skills. Invite 1, 2, or 3 friends and acquaintances from all over the world to play with you. Each of you takes turns to draw a randomly selected phrase on the screen while the remaining players hurry to be the first person to guess that phrase. The players are able to see one another’s guesses. The sooner the correct phrase is guessed, the more points go to the drawer’s and the successful guesser’s accounts.

The application is fully translated into English, Spanish, French, German, and Polish. Each language version contains a few thousands ideally selected phrases: single words, phrases, sayings, and proverbs. We take care of our game and make it constantly attractive by regularly updating and improving the phrase base. Each user can also submit his or her own proposals and suggestions! The language of the phrase dictionary can be changed at any moment so that you can try your strength in other languages. The interface is in agreement with your local settings.

The game ends after 500 points have been reached – at that moment in the archive you will find a few tens of pictures, drawn by you and your friends. The pictures can be marked as favorite, sent by e-mail to your acquaintances, or published on Facebook."

Source: The Game Website.

121571.name: Sword & Shield Pocket Rules
121571.description:
From the back page:

The ancient tower brooded over the landscape for as long as anyone can remember. Animals and people alike avoided the bleak ruins. Old Beric claimed an ancient evil rested beneath, dreaming of its release. Strange lights were spotted dancing within the crumbling edifice during the last full moon. Now the trees nearby have become twisted and rotted, while the grass has blackened and died. Do you have the courage to take up your sword and shield, venture into the unknown, and discover the dangers within?

This booklet is a sample of the Sword & Shield game. It provides the basics of game play and character creation. The full rules contain many more classes, more magic, special abilities and more monsters!

121572.name: Sword & Shield Pocket Rules V2
121572.description:
From the back page:

The ancient tower brooded over the landscape for as long as anyone can remember. Animals and people alike avoided the bleak ruins. Old Beric claimed an ancient evil rested beneath, dreaming of its release. Strange lights were spotted dancing within the crumbling edifice during the last full moon. Now the trees nearby have become twisted and rotted, while the grass has blackened and died. Do you have the courage to take up your sword and shield, venture into the unknown, and discover the dangers within?

This booklet is a sample of the Sword & Shield game. It provides the basics of game play and character creation. The full rules contain many more classes, more magic, special abilities and more monsters!

121573.name: Cybernarium
121573.description:
"Cybernarium is a highly addictive breakout with stylish cyberpunk look and feel. It's physics based dynamic circular arenas that fight back, manually activated reflective shields to use at panic moments and to keep the ball on the arena while you're dodging the enemy turrets, missiles to finish the level faster or destroy the turrets before they shoot you - it's not only a new dimension of challenge, it's a completely new look and feel for the good old genre, just try it!"

Source: The Developer Website.

121574.name: Maddog
121574.description:
User Summary

A side-view Dog simulator. The player controls a dog, gameplay consists of doing what the dog currently thinks about: if the dog is hungry, you'll have to catch a bird or find food. If he wants to play, find a ball and play with it. The better you are, the more happy the dog is and the longer he lives.

The game logo was the inspiration for Titus' company logo.

121575.description:
A mini game for 2 players by David Smith

Published in Plato magazine

Before You Start


Draw a large circle and place 9 circular spaces at equal intervals around the circle.
One player uses 4 small silver coins as pieces.
The other player uses 4 small bronze coins.


The Play


Each player in turn places one of their pieces on the playing board until all but one of the nine spaces is occupied.
Then each player at each turn must either
move an own piece into an adjacent space in either direction or
single jump one own piece over one adjacent enemy piece into an empty space immediately beyond the enemy piece (As in Chinese Checkers) or
double jump one own piece over two enemy pieces one space apart with vacant spaces between and immediately beyond the two pieces jumper over. (Like a double jump in Chinese Checkers).

Pieces jumped over are captured and removed from the board.
Last player with a piece or pieces still in play wins the game.


Copyright 2007 David L. Smith, NZ
121575.name: Leap Frog

121576.description:
4 Sisu cards have been included as goodie in Plato magazine #44 (march 2012).

“Sisu” is a Finnish word to describe the fighting spirit of a Finnish driver.

Each player has a Sisu card he can play once per rally to cancel a loss of control. Discard the Sisu card and make your move without taking into account /!\ symbols.

The Sisu card cannot be used to cancel a loss of control caused by approaching a turn too quickly.
121576.name: Rallyman: Sisu cards

121577.name: 1000 Bornes
121577.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the classic boardgame, one player versus the computer: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/590/mille-bornes

121578.name: Cities in Motion: Collection
121578.description:
Rendered in rich detail, some of the world’s greatest cities- await the steady hand of a planner to manage their transportation needs in Cities in Motion.
Overseeing the changing needs of people from 1920 to 2020, it’s up to you to manage everything from buses, trams and subway trains to maximize profits while pleasing commuters

Included within the collection are:
Cities in Motion
Cities in Motion Design Classics
Cities in Motion Design Marvels
Cities in Motion Design Now
Cities in Motion Tokyo
Cities in Motion Metro Station
Cities in Motion German Cities

Source: The Publisher Website.

121579.name: Amstra-Dames
121579.description:
User Summary

A checkers game implementation. 7 levels of play, a demonstration mode, an option for changing sides in the middle of the game.

121580.name: Blue War
121580.description:
User Summary

A submarine simulation game set during an unspecified conflict. The back of the box says:

"Set sail on a voyage that could change the whole of your future to come. As midshipman in command of a U39 submarine and its 35 crew, you must stalk the deep in search of enemy craft - destroyers, corvettes and merchant shipping. Keep a watchful eye on your sonar, radio and radar navigation equipment for when contact is made you must strike with deadly speed.

Promotion to the admiralty beckons. This top flight simulation offers you many perilous missions in which to prove your sea worthiness."

121581.name: Booly
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121581.description:
User Summary

Puzzle game. The back of the box says:

"Solving the 300 different stages available to you requires a maximum of thought and strategy. The prupose of BOOLY makes it a simple game to play, but only the most relentless logic will make you win and progress in the championship. Let's take an example: in the first stage, every blue square must become grey. It appears to be easy, but if you remember that some of these objects are connected to each other and that you dispose of a limited time... You see things differently.
Alone or with other players, plunge into this puzzle game that offers you a multitude of options like the integrated stage editor. Truly a captivating game, thanks to its simple rules and the great diversity of its levels: welcome to a world of long hours of entertainment!"

121582.name: Destined Hero
121582.description:
What turns a young man into a world-saving Hero?

A sacred spear, discovered at just the right moment, might give him the edge he needs to best the evil Fiend. But now the spear is locked in a treasure chest! Better make sure he finds the moon key, which can open any lock. And that mountain pass is home to a red wyrm; he'll probably need some winged boots to make it through in one piece. Perhaps you should place a healing spring on the far side so he can tend his wounds?

Destined Hero is a 2 player strategy game in which you play the forces of destiny trying to raise up a Hero or bring him to ruin. You must have the vision to see what the Hero will need to surmount the tasks that await him, and plant the seeds in prehistory that will bear fruit in the moment of fate. Distribute treasures and allies to aid the Hero, or monsters and obstacles to hinder him, and choose the abilities to bestow upon each. The world you create can make or break the journey as the Hero attempts to make his way to war against the Fiend.

The final battle approaches – but the outcome is surely no mystery to one who sees the threads of fate. After all, it's not really about the Hero... It's about the destiny that awaits him.

Game Data:

Complexity: 2.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 2 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit represents either the Hero or the Fiend in an epic battle to decide the fate of the world.

Game Components:

• One 4-page full color Instructions sheet
• One 4-page full color Player Aid sheet
• One 11” x 17” map
• 45 double-sided 1/2" round markers
• 40 cards
• Includes Designer's Notes and Optional Rules

121583.name: 750cc Grand Prix
121583.description:
User Summary

A motorcycle racing simulation game. The game includes four racetracks modelled after existing ones (the starting track is Silverstone). The game keeps track of fuel reserves and tyre wear, and the player may have to make a pit stop during the race.

121584.name: Spiral Knights: Operation Crimson Hammer
121584.description:
Warmaster Seerus is the evil master of munitions within the gremlin's all-powerful Crimson Order. Thought to be the true mastermind behind the Roarmulus Twins and countless other gremlin weapons, he is the Crimson Order’s creator and supplier for their diabolical engines of war.

Recon Knights under the command of Lieutenant Feron recently discovered Seerus’s ‘Grand Arsenal,’ his development center and storage facility for all his weaponry. Now, Feron himself is leading several squads of knights directly into the Grand Arsenal, with the intention of weeding out Seerus and destroying his war machines.

Met with heavy resistance, Feron’s squads require reinforcements and Spiral HQ is sending you in to assist.

Source: The Publisher Website.

121585.name: Lost Horizon
121585.description:
User Summary

A traditional point-and-click, 3rd-person adventure game.


1936: Soldiers of the Third Reich roam the world seeking occult weapons for their insane plans of conquest.
When Fenton Paddock, a former British soldier and hapless smuggler, is asked to look for his friend Richard, who went missing in Tibet, he has no idea that this search will lead him across three continents to a secret that could turn the whole world upside down.

Enough mystery? Not in the mood for another crime story? Lost Horizon brings the classic adventure back to its roots: the 1930s, exotic settings all over the world, and the dangerous quest for one of the greatest secrets of mankind makes adventurers' hearts beat faster. The Makers of the award-winning Secret Files series invite you to experience a technically outstanding, carefully designed game featuring an absolutely thrilling story at the side of Kim and Fenton.

- Unique handmade graphic style
- Exotic settings you've never seen before
- Movie-like story by novelist Claudia Kern
- Both realistic and funny dialogues
- Excellent technical appearance and minimal system requirements
- Fast-paced presentation of the exciting story in movie style
- Innovative puzzle design, always fair and logical

Source: The Publisher Website.

121586.name: Brainstorm
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121586.description:
User Summary

Puzzle game. One or two balls bounce around a screen made of coloured squares. The goal of each level is to trap the ball(s) in a red square before the timer runs out by means of three lines the player can move around by clicking on the playing surface.

The game has 26 levels and 3 difficulty levels.

121587.name: Tales From Space: Mutant Blobs Attack
121587.description:
Tales from Space: Mutant Blobs Attack is a side-scrolling puzzle-platformer about a grumpy mutant Blob that escapes into the world and starts eating everything around him. A follow-up to PSN Platformer Tales from Space: About a Blob, Mutant Blobs Attack features new levels, new powers and controls, and a new Blob player character. The game is being created for the PlayStation®Vita handheld entertainment system.
In Mutant Blobs Attack the player-Blob grows by eating loose objects in the game environment. Over the course of each level, the player encounters a series of obstacles he must grow large enough to bypass. The game combines traditional 2D thumbstick-based platforming controls with touch-based powers and abilities. Physics-based puzzles are often mixed in with the action.

Source: The Game Website.

121588.name: Cluedo
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
English/European ZX Spectrum Cassette (Square Box re-release) edition
121588.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the boardgame "Clue". Up to 6 players can play, the rest of the players are managed by the computer.

121589.name: Magical Vacation
121589.description:
This article is about the Game Boy Advance game Magical Vacation. For the sequel, see Magical Starsign.
Magical Vacation (マジカルバケーション majikaru bakēshon?) is a 2001 role-playing video game developed by Brownie Brown and published by Nintendo for the Game Boy Advance only in Japan on December 7, 2001, and was later re-released in the same region in 2006. Japanese singer, model, and actress Mika Nakashima was featured in the television commercials for Magical Vacation.
Plot
Once upon a time, war erupted for three days in the magic kingdom Kovomaka. This war was kept a secret from ordinary citizens, but one man began to travel all around the country in preparation for the next battle, and several years later, the game's main character enters the magic school Will-O-Wisp at the invitation of the school's principal. The main character possessed the ability to see and interact with spirits since youth, and was ostracized because of this ability.
The students of the Will-O-Wisp school are sent away to a summer school by the Valencia seaside despite warnings that several students from other schools had gone missing on the beach in the past. One afternoon, a strange monster called an Enigma appears on the beach, abducting some of the students. The hero must find the missing students and uncover the mysteries of the Enigma and war that occurred in the kingdom.

Source: Wikipedia, "Magical Vacation", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121590.name: Yum Bingo
121590.description:
As with traditional bingo, the goal is to be first to fill in the game card so as to reproduce the pattern selected at the beginning of the game.

Game Cards have boxes to fill in. Though they are all different, the game cards present all of the same combinations. On a total of 25 boxes, you will find 9 différent combinations.

Progress of the game; To get the desired combined value, all players have the right to roll the dice up to 3 times each turn. All six dice must be used for the first roll, but for the 2nd and 3rd rolls, the player has the choice of the number of dice to be rolled.

121591.name: Rave Master: Special Attack Force!
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
121591.description:
Rave Master: Special Attack Force! is a 2-d video game of the fighting game genre. It is based on the Japanese anime called Rave Master (or Groove Adventure Rave in Japan). It was released for Nintendo's Game Boy Advance. In all, it has 14 playable characters and five modes of playing.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rave Master: Special Attack Force!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121592.name: Coloric
121592.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game in which the player must paint each of the squares of a 7x10 grid with the same colour before the timer runs out, while avoiding squares of the forbidden colour. The forbidden colour changes periodically.

Between stages there is a short memory game in which the player can gain bonus points.

121593.name: Colossus Chess 4
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121593.description:
User Summary

A Chess program, with several levels of play, a problem-solving mode, several displays available (2d or isometric 3d), play with or without clock...

121594.name: Colossus Backgammon
121594.description:
User Summary

A computer game implementation of the classic game Backgammon.

121595.name: Colossus Mahjong
121595.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the classic game Mahjong. The player plays the East Wind, the computer assumes the role of the other players. It has nine levels of play, four tutorials, a demonstration mode and a tournament mode.

121596.name: Computer Scrabble
videogameversion: English / European BBC B 5 1/4" Disc (Square box re-release) edition
English / European BBC B 5 1/4" Disc edition
English / European BBC B Cassette edition
English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette (Leisure Genius re-release) edition
English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121596.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the classic board game Scrabble. One to four players, four difficulty levels, over 12000 words in the game database.

121597.name: Solar Coaster
121597.description:
User Summary

A budget vertical scrolling shoot'em up. Destroy every alien wave until you reach the enemy mothership and destroy it.

121598.name: Python Pete
121598.description:
User Summary

A budget clone of the classic action game where a snake must eat items on the screen while dodging poisoned mushrooms and his own tail.

121599.description: Each game of Knock Down Barns begins with two players designing and building their own structure out of small rectangular blocks of reclaimed barn wood. Building is done in secret behind a barn wood divider that crosses the center of the barn wood (or bamboo) playing board. Many strategies are used in building a solid structure as to withstand attack from your opponent. Once both players finish building a structure that is taller than the center divider, the divider is removed before the battle begins. Cylindrical foam weapons are fired by flicking them at each others' structure. Alternate shots and the first player to completely clear the blocks off of their opponent's side of the board wins. It is customary to shake hands with your opponent after every game of #KdB. Remember, You can always build again!©
121599.name: Knock Down Barns
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep. 13.5 Board Game Blitz
Episode 38 :: Haspelknecht Review + Academy Games Interview
The Spiel #208 - Captains of Industry

121600.name: Defenders of Faith
121600.description:
Jesus Christ has promised us that he will be returning, and as a follower of Christ we know that this is true. But what about the people that don't know? Jesus gave us our great commission to go into all the corners of the world and share the gospel, and that is exactly what we will do.

Your character cards will be your friends, your family and your fellow church members, each with their own set of unique skills and encouragements. When a coal is separate from the fire, it grows cold. Keep great people around you and your faith will grow.

You will also have support, in the form of churches, bible studies, small groups and even education. These support cards will stay in play and give you greater opportunities to travel and spread out across the world. But the mission field starts right at home, will you witness to your neighbor or to a total stranger?

You may travel across the entire globe on mission trips. Some may be only for a single turn (think of it as a youth group trip to the Ukraine or Mexico) and some may take over the rest of the game (such as settling a family in another country, or becoming a pastor for a military branch overseas). Wherever you go, you will always have people to witness to.
