A vertical scolling shoot'em up. The back of the box says:

"Enter the Speedzone in a frantic defence against marauding alien forces. A survey ship sent into the area comes under attack. As an enemy vessel draws closer your "STARFIRE" class attack craft is launched."

121694.name: Espionage
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121694.description:
User Summary

A turn-based computer board game for 1 to 4 players (humans and/or computer). The goal of the game is to capture the four microfilms in the middle in the board and move them back to one's base. Each player has a team of 12 agents, with different chess-like movement capabilities (some move like a bishop, others like a queen, others like a rook). Agents can capture enemy agents (again like chess), earning points and a microfilm if the captured piece had one. Capture is mandatory: if a player passes a capture opportunity, the other player can capture that player's piece. A player can also invert the position of two of her pieces.

Each player take turns moving an agent, until all the microfilms are collected and stored in bases. The player with the highest score is the winner.

121695.name: Evil Donjon
121695.description:
User Summary

A Lode Runner clone, with ghosts and magic potions instead of gold.

121696.description:
A strategic American football action game with hidden movable defenders and a fold-out stadium. Gameboard inserts are available for conversion to Basketball, Soccer, Ice Hockey & Australian Rules Football (see images).

Before each play, the Defensive player (D) secretly sets his Linebackers (3 blue INDEPENDENTLY MOVABLE static-cling dots) on a hinged, clear plastic, overlay. He then swings the overlay against side of stadium and hides the Linebackers with a large black card.

The Offensive player then studies the tacklers printed on the field, HIDES HIS EYES WITH HIS PLAYBOOK, and either marks a line on the field with a dry-erase pen on a run, or lifts the pen and tries to land on a pass receiver (and then runs from there). D tells him when he runs into a tackler, and then both players look at the field while D flips the overlay onto the field to see if a Linebacker tackled him sooner, caused a fumble, or batted down/intercepted a pass.

From the website:
"With a dry-erase pen and your eyes covered by a Playbook, how well can you evade tacklers, pass to receivers, or execute kicking plays? That’s the challenge of Out of Sight Football! But beware your opponent’s hidden Linebackers! They can Stuff Runs, Intercept Passes, Cause Fumbles, or Blitz when you least expect it! Includes Kickoffs, Punts, Field Goals, Sacks, Safeties, Blocked Kicks, Fake Kicks, Laterals, Run/Pass Blocking, Injuries, Clock Management, Slo-Mo Replays, a Playbook with fifteen offensive play choices plus directional play variations (right, left, middle) for OVER 40 total play choices."

A great way to learn football. See Videos below for more info.
121696.name: Out of 'Sight' Football

121697.name: Hellfrost Adventure Compendium 2
121697.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Lost but not completely forgotten, the City of Paraxus lies in the Barony of Cul and is rumoured to hold the hidden knowledge of the Heligi people, a long extinct people. Can the heroes find the lost manuscripts and tomes of knowledge? Or perhaps the heroes will be searching for gold, gems and other items of value in the exploration of The Lost City of Paraxus.
Unable to cure the insanity of the locals with herbs or magic, the cult of Eira hires a band of hardened adventurers to investigate the source of the insanity that is spreading amongst the inhabitants. From a village of fools to a more serious menace driven into the abyss of madness, the heroes must follow the path of lunacy and risk their own sanity in Descent into Madness.
The Ice Fiend & Other Tales is a set of four fantastic mini-adventures. In The Ice Fiend our heroes are asked to hunt a savage wolf that is terrorising a local farmers sheep stock. Or that is what they think! If your heroes want to see battle then A Brief Encounter is for them! When you are hired to escort some livestock to the local overlord for tribute it seems like an easy way to earn some money. However this is quickly forgotten as at every step along the way the heroes are attacked by a variety of opponents - in Taxation Troubles. The Haunted Woods harbour trouble for our heroes. After pitching camp near a dark mysterious forest one of the characters spy a strang pale white light approaching their camp. It is a Fey Knight who commands the characters to track and kill a strange creature.
The Fey Tower is an adventure set on the coastline of Rassilon. For the past five months the inhabitants of the coastal village of Gairloch have been plagued by giant crabs. Can the heroes discover the reason for the crabs to venture on land?
The Deadly Glade is hidden away in the dark and leafy boughs of the Stone Forest. No brightly colored flowers grow here, as they do elsewhere; only plants of midnight-blue. For a decade, one priest of Vali has been feeding the plants on the decaying corpses of disease victims, letting their pus and tainted, putrefying flesh feed his deadly blooms. These flowers attract bees which in turn are poisoned by the sticky nectar. The fast-acting poison warps the bees, turning them into voracious hunters. The plan is as simple as it is bold to create an army of killer bees which will be unleashed on the unsuspecting citizens of Rassilon. Can this hideous plot be thwarted?
Hellfrost Adventure Compendium 2 is designed to be used with the Hellfrost Players Guide, Bestiary & Gazetteer using the award winning Savage Worlds RPG.

121698.name: Hellfrost Saga of the Frost Giants
121698.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Take up arms & fight the evil frost giant Jarl Hrimwulf the Grim in this epic mini-campaign.

Welcome to Saga of the Frost Giants!

N3: Shadow of Darkness:
Joining a caravan as guards is a way to earn good money, though it is not without its risks. Having signed up as guards, the heroes are about to take part in a journey from the lands around Hellfrost Keep, to the distant Saxa steads of the Icebarrier Mountains. The caravan must weather many goblin attacks but it soon becomes clear the goblins are not acting alone. Something more powerful is behind their attacks, something with grander plans than a few raids.


S1: The Siege of Watchgap Fort:
With night falling, the strong walls of the Fort offer sanctuary. Or so you thought, for no sooner have the heroes settled down when an alarm is raised -- a goblin army is besieging Watchgap Fort! Will you answer the call to arms, or will your courage fail you when it is most needed?


V1: The Heart of Winter:
Summer draws near, and the village of Torton is preparing for its annual festival in honor of Thunor. It is a time of celebration and happiness, and the heroes are welcome guests. But hidden away from the warmth, a creature of terrible cold plots and plans the destruction of the world. Through the awesome power of the winter god, Thrym, the servant of evil plans to bring about the Fimbulvintr. Should it succeed, the Hearthlands will be punged into perpetual winter. The cry goes out for heroes! Are the characters ready to face their greatest threat? Is their destiny to destroy the Heart of Winter or die trying?


L1: The Frost Giant's Hold:
Three times the heroes have interfered in the plans of Jarl Hrimwulf the Grim, and three times the heroes have vanquished the jarl’s minions. But now the Norns have decreed the final act must play out between the mighty frost giant and the mortal adventurers. At stake is nothing less that the fate of the Hearthlands. After facing death on the shores of White Lake battle must be taken to The Frost Giant’s Hold!
Hellfrost Saga of the Frost Giants is designed to be used with the Hellfrost Player’s Guide, Bestiary & Gazetteer using the award winning Savage Worlds RPG.

121699.name: Hellfrost Adventure Compendium 1
121699.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This book contains a collection of four Novice fantasy adventures designed for the popular Hellfrost setting. Each adventure gives detailed information for the GM and includes all the story background, maps and full creature stats for easy play.
Adventures contained in this book are:

Lair of the Vermin Lord
The Dark Seed
Pirates of the Crystalflow

121700.name: All For One: Le Mousquetaire Déshonoré
121700.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Revenge is a dish best served cold!
Le Mousquetaire Déshonoré is a four part adventure campaign for the musketeer roleplaying game —All For One Régime Diabolique.
At its core, Le Mousquetaire Déshonoré is a tale of revenge involving a former King’s Musketeer. Thrown out of the company for being caught in the act of a heinous crime, Delmar Boulanger blames four musketeers for his ouster. Vigorously resisting his arrest Boulanger was severely disfigured during a fight and lost an eye.

This bitter and disgraced musketeer spent a little over a decade learning to fight with one eye and plotting his revenge.

Each adventure in this amazing campaign follows his path to revenge!
All for One: Régime Diabolique is the award-winning musketeer roleplaying game from Triple Ace Games.

121701.name: Luchador: Bright Lights & Barbed Wire
121701.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Don the mask and dive into danger!

Luchador: Bright Lights and Barbed Wire brings the action north to the States. Prepare for the grandeur and gore of All American Action!
Add new specialties to your character!

Create new Giant and Mini characters for your cadre of Luchadors!

Acquire a valet of your very own!

Test your talents in the new adventure: Knights of Terror!

The Luchaverse keeps growing! Don't miss out!

121702.name: Gatecrasher
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121702.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game in which the player must drop barrels down tunnels so that they land in boxes. The tunnels have several possible entry points, and gates which influence the direction of the barrel and can be toggled if the barrel reaches the gate from the opposite direction. The player must find the correct sequence in order to fill each of the nine boxes with barrels.

121703.name: Spitting Image
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121703.description:
Game Sleeve Text

"Within the next seven years a world war will take place. A war so great that even the Swiss will get involved this time. A war so terrible the Italians have already surrendered. One leader will emerge from this war to rule the world.

It is your task to stop this leader and SAVE THE WORLD."

User Summary

A Beat'em up themed after Spitting Image, a satyrical puppet show broadcast on UK's ITV in the 1980s. Choose one of six world leaders (you can choose Ronald Reagan, Margaret Thatcher, ayatollah Khomeini, Mikhail Gorbatchev, the Pope or Peter Botha) and beat each of the five others, before fighting an unknown "great evil".

In traditional beat'em up fashion, each character has special moves and attacks.

121704.name: Gridtrap
121704.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game in which a character must travel across a grid in order to defuse a bomb. Whenever the character leaves a tile, it disappears, and once a bomb has been reached and defused, another appears on the grid. The character must defuse 7 bombs to reach the next level. In addition to the disappearing floors, there are hazards the character must avoid, like electric boots or skulls and crossbones.

121705.name: Halls of Gold
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121705.description:
User Summary

A Lode Runner clone, with 48 levels (24 levels for the main game, 24 others for the championship mode), and a level editor.

121706.name: Guardians
121706.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game in which the player must construct a wall to prevent energy spheres from escaping a tunnel. The wall can be built by picking up tiles, which are not always available, and while the player is building the wall, she can't bounce the spheres back, loosing energy.

The game has 80 levels.

121708.name: Mera Brainstorm
121708.description: Expansion to the Swedish version of Brainstorm, published by Casper. Contains 360 new categories of 10 words each. Also contains a new rules version introducing the opportunity to challenge an opponent, tweaking step 3, 4, 6 and 7 in the turn.

121709.name: Charad
121709.description:
Despite what the name indicates this Swedish game is a draw-and-guess game. The game consists of a number of cards with words or phrases on them in different categories. The players take turn trying to make a fast sketch illustrating one of the words on a card. All the other participants try to guess and points ar distributed if you guess correct and to the sketching player if someone manages to guess right. You only count the points, there are no pieces on a board.

It is in many ways similar to Pictionary but without a game board and not played in teams. The categories are (translated from Swedish):
Objects
Verbs
Abstract terms
Names oc Titles
Technical terms
Proverbs

121710.name: Star Chamber: The Harbinger Saga
videogamehonor: 2005 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
121710.description:
One of Star Chamber’s primary distinctions is that it combines traditional CCG elements (card collecting and trading, deck building, the use of cards in-game, etc.) with a board wargame-style map and unit production based on locations on that map, in some ways similar to the classic Master of Orion series. There are 43 unique maps, with random elements incorporated into some of those maps. The titular Star Chamber is a location at which voting session between players’ citizens takes place every sixth turn. Players vote for the Power Play, Alien Support, and Peacekeepers (see Voting below).

There are three ways to win a game of Star Chamber: Military Victory (conquering the opponent’s homeworld), Cultural Victory (having a “destiny point” advantage of 30 or more points; destiny points are generally gained by controlling “artifact planets”), and Political Victory (winning three Power Play votes).

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Chamber: The Harbinger Saga", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121713.name: Full Sysselsättning
121713.description:
A game about managing a towship and handle how the tax payers money ar best put into use.

The game consists of a large plastic circular board on which the players get a 6th. The board is separated into squares on which the players can build. By doing so they manage differend aspects of a township, like a political administration in a small town. The game has a path around the edges on which the players move. Those spaces give them different opportunities and makes the players dra cards containing various events, much like the cards in Monopoly. One interesting thing in this game from 1975 is that the players mark their buildings on the plastic board using whiteboard markers. This must have been a rather early use of that in a boardgame.

Includes land development, unemployment issues, building of inustries, malls, water cleaning facilities, summer house areas and family homes. Four different variants of the rules provide different levels of difficulty. There is also squares for "?"-cards which is a variant where the players are meant to construct cards of there own to tweak the game.

121714.name: Föreningsspel
121714.description:
Swedish game about running a lokal athlete club, where you as a manager will have to deal with player salaries, national review boards, tax administration, sponsorships etc.

The game has borrowed a lot of mechanics from Monopoly, but instead of streets the board consists of a number of local business, local to different areas i Sweden. The game exists in a number of variants, similar as a game but with different local business on the board. The players make deals with the business (instead of buying the street) and build arinas and VIP-booths (instead of houses and hotels). There are random events on cards and you walk around the board using 2 dices. There are also charade cards (!) where you are awarded money if you manage to get the co-players to understand the charad. The one who has the larges fortune after a set time is declared the winner.

121715.name: HIRÞ
121715.description:
HIRÞ (pronounced hɪrð, i.e., with a th-sound as in "the" at the end) is a two-player abstract strategy game in which two leaders (Viking kings) fight over control of a piece of land. The first to either control the five middle spaces or push the other player's king off the board wins. Although it has a relatively small board (eleven squares), the ability to use moves to build stronger units makes the gameplay quite intricate. The game is designed in recent times but with the ambition of resembling a game that could potentially have been found in a Viking grave.

In the game, the players start on each short end of the board and take turns. Each turn they can make five moves. For a move, a player either moves one piece (Hird or King) one step, moves a Hird into or off a Karve (boat), or moves a Karve and all Hirds on it one step. A Karve may have at most four Hirds on it. Pieces entering empty spaces have to stop. Pieces entering enemy-controlled spaces stop on the line between the spaces. After a player's five moves, any conflicts (pieces on lines) are resolved. All pieces except empty Karve are worth 1. The King is tiebreaker. In case of a loss, solitary Hirds are removed from the game, Karves and Hirds in Karves are removed from play, and Kings have to retreat to an adjacent empty or friendly space. If there are no possible squares for the King to move to, the player loses. If after their turn a player controls all five middle spaces, that player wins.

There is also a doubling coin in the game affecting points received if several games are played. Normally a game is won after receiving five points.

121716.name: Korsordsspel
121716.description:
A cross word game for two players were each player play letters allowing the opponent to use the same letter they play. They form words on one grid each.

The game consists of two boards on which the players build their words. No building on the other players board. The game also consists of a number of letter tiles. The players takes turn in choosing to play one letter, and thus giving both players the opportunity to include that letter in their words. It is important to choose letters that not only builds good words for you but also to not choose letters that enables the opponent to build good words. At the end of the game the words reward points. The most points wins.

121717.name: Visions (Issue 01 - 1999)
121717.description:
Regulars

•Newsdesk - The latest on major developments in the RPG scene - who's releasing what and when - who's starting up and why
•Small Worlds - Taking a look at the Gripping Beast and Alternative Armies for table-top RPGs or for large scale fantasy Wargames
•News Decks - Babylon 5 Psi Corps meets Willy Wonk; Star Wars The Phantom Menace Card Set; Plus details of the WOTC card Redemption Scheme
•Paper cuts - Letting you in on what's happening in the comic and graphic worlds of great art and even greater tales of guts, glory and glamour
•Live Show - Getting Down and doing it for real whether it's in furs or black leather - we take a look at the LRP scene in the UK and elsewhere; who's running what, when and where
•Critical Hits - There are more fantasy, horror and SF books than you could read in a month of Sundays - our special reviewer has been burning the midnight oil finding the best for you
•Oz News - News on what's going on down-under with the clubs, RPGs and events in Australia
•Dork Tower - Yes it's here, exclusive to visions, entirely new, never before printed cartoons- RPG's answer to Dilbert
•Event Horizon - Short Convention and exhibition reports plus contacts and prices for the up and coming events you can attend

Features

•Fistful of Dwarfs- Role-Playing as it was never meant to be, read Phil Masters' setting and scenarios for GURPS Discworld.
•A kind of magic - A complete scenario based on the School of Night, a society of Hermetic Mages in Elizabethan London
•Review - Star Trek: TNG - Another five year mission to boldly play those games that no one has played before? Well Maybe, does the ST:TNG game live up to Jean-Luc
•Review -Deadland: Hell on Earth - Bringing the Horror of the Weird West to a Post-Apocalyptic terror - how does this match up to the original Deadlands?
•Review - C&S Light - Full playtest review of the latest incarnation of one of the oldest games of the RPG world - the cut down version of C&S 3rd Edition
•Video Clips - Taking a look at the films that are worth a second look, and some that aren't

121718.name: Ethnos
121718.description:
User Summary

A kingdom management game. You have 1000 years to develop your country's economy, culture and religion (each game turn is 10 years of game time). Even though you can develop your military, the ultimate goal is to merge with your neighbour, the Amstrid kingdom, and destroying them militarily yields less points at the end of the game than other, more peaceful means.

121719.name: Shaun Palmer's Pro Snowboarder
121719.description:
Shaun Palmer's Pro Snowboarder is a PlayStation 2 game with a similar feel to the Tony Hawk's Pro Skater series, published by Activision 02. The game features many famous snowboarders including Shaun Palmer and Shaun White. A sequel was in development by Treyarch, but was later canceled.

This game was released on PlayStation 2, Game Boy Advance & Game Boy Color. However, a demo of this game was released on a demo disc from Sony, as well as exists in the options menu of Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shaun Palmer's Pro Snowboarder", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121720.name: Shrek: Super Party
121720.description:
Shrek: Super Party is based on the Shrek movie series but is similar to the Mario Party series of games. The characters Shrek, Fiona, Donkey, Lord Farquaad, Thelonius, and Monsieur Hood are available for play. Five realms are available for play, each with its own mini-games: The Keep, The Windmill, The Swamp, The Castle, and The Farm. The cover features four colored castles and four characters Shrek, Donkey, Princess Fiona, and Lord Farquaad.

The purpose of the game Shrek Super Party is to be the first player to collect a certain number of "Precious Drops". This number can be preset in the "game settings" menu at the beginning of the game as anything between 200 and 800 in intervals of 100. The drops can be collected through making bug matches or by reaching "Realm Caches".

Each player chooses a realm to traverse toward a "Realm Cache". The game is set up along a board game model, with each player taking turns moving spaces along paths towards the "Realm Cache". Player movement is determined by a ball-drop game over a three-by-three numbered grid, with each of the numbered squares corresponding to a different number of spaces the player moves forward: 1-9. Each square also results in a different outcome. The possible outcomes include: Epic Battle, Daring Duel, Lose Drops, Gain Drops, Magic Mirror, Boots (which send the player to the evil bog), Magic Portal, Pixie Dust, Short Cut, and the final Realm Cache. The squares Magic Mirror, Boots, Magic Portal, Pixie Dust, and Short Cut appear only once per realm.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shrek: Super Party", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121723.name: Zombie Zone
121723.description:
This is the first game in the OneChanbara series. It established the hack and slash gameplay with the player controlling Aya, a Japanese cowgirl in a bikini who wears a scarf and wields a katana. The player is pitted against hordes of zombies and nightmarish boss creatures, who spill torrents of blood when they are attacked.

Players guide their characters through the stages, completing tasks while hacking through enemies. The player-character's weapon becomes progressively covered in blood, causing their attacks to be slower and to inflict less damage, even getting stuck in enemies if it gets too bad. This is represented by a "Blood Meter" showing how dirty the weapon is. To prevent this, players must actively clean off their sword to keep the blood meter from filling up.

In addition, there is also the "Blood Lust" meter. As a character kills enemies, this meter starts to fill. Once the meter is full, the character will go into a "blood frenzy". This gives the character an increase in attack power, but drains health. To recover from a blood frenzy, the player must use statue items, which are dropped by dead enemies. Additionally each level will contain a large statue. Going to the large statue will remove the blood frenzy and also recover any lost health.

Source: Wikipedia, "Simple 2000 Series Vol. 61: The Oneechanbara", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

For proposed sequels and new platform projects for this game series, see the developer's website at:
http://www.d3p.co.jp/one/portal.html

121724.name: Forbidden Siren 2
121724.description:
Forbidden Siren 2, known in Japan as Siren 2 (サイレン２ Sairen Tsū), builds upon that of its predecessor, Siren, with some significant improvements, namely the ability for characters to crouch-walk, a proximity alert that warns the player of nearby enemies, a hint system that guides the player to the current mission objective, three selectable difficulty levels, and an optional first-person mode. Context-sensitive interactions now require only a single button press when prompted, and bringing up the in-game menu for common interactions no longer pauses the game. Important items remain in the inventory after restarting a scenario.

The "sightjack" system has been improved by allowing the player to automatically sightjack nearby enemies. Character-specific features have also been incorporated, such as Shu Mikami's ability to move while sightjacking due to his near blindness, Ikuko's ability to control sightjacked enemies, and Akiko's ability to reveal psychic impressions when sightjacking in certain areas.

In contrast to the mainly stealth-based tactics of the previous game, players can now freely choose between stealth and action. The new combat system introduces a three-hit combo attack. Characters are also able to attack barehanded (although extremely weak and only effective to repel attackers in order to run away). Characters may also use guns as melee weapons. Many more weapons are available for each character, with many of them being improvised.

The shibito are slightly faster, more aggressive, and more intelligent than they were previously. However, they are still just as easy to distract from their usual habits. Once defeated, they revive only when a shiryo (屍霊 shiryō, lit. "corpse spirit") re-enters the corpse. The player can prevent a shibito from being revived by eliminating the shiryo with a weapon hit or flashlight.

A new type of enemy is introduced, called the yamibito (闇人 yamibito, lit. "darkness people"), which, although much more resilient, aggressive, and intelligent than the shibito, function essentially the same way. They are also repelled by light, meaning that they can be weakened by focusing a flashlight on them or turning on the lights in a room. Like the shibito, a yamibito can be defeated, but is revived when a yamirei (闇霊 yamirei, lit. "darkness spirit") re-enters the corpse. Eliminating the yamirei (which are also intolerant to light) renders the yamibito unconscious indefinitely. However, due to their improved intelligence and strength, yamibito will not fall for distractions that may have worked on shibito, and they are also much harder to defeat in combat.

Source: Wikipedia, "Forbidden Siren 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121725.name: Highway Encounter
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121725.description:
User Summary

An action game in isometric 3D. The player must travel along a highway, avoiding or blasting enemies, while pushing a special weapon which must be used against the alien base at the end of the road. The game box says:

"THE ALIENS have invaded earth. There's only one road left to travel, before they reach their final goal - total world domination. Your mission, to halt their advance. And ultimately destroy their alien stronghold, 'Zone Zero'.
Under your control are five Vortons. And the 'Lasertron' - the world's most advanced weapon system, which must be taken to Zone Zero to complete your mission.
Fail. And face the deadly consequences as the future of earth rests in your hands. So prepare for battle... Prepare yourself for the Highway Encounter."

121727.name: Alien Highway
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121727.description:
User Summary

The sequel of Highway Encounter, using the same isometric 3D view and similar gameplay. The back of the box says:

"HISTORY RECALLS the epic 'Highway Encounter'. The attempted domination of Earth by the dreaded Alien aggressor was foiled by the power of the Vortons.

Your mission is to strike at the industrial heart of the Alien Empire, before they remass with even greater force. As controller of the Vorton you must manoeuvre the Terratron to the end of the 'Alien Highway'. It is vital the Terratron be energized en route by contact with seven regeneration stations. Only by achieving this can you proceed through the barrier guarding the Industrial Complex. There, the Terratron will reveal its awesome power."

121728.name: Smash Court Tennis Pro Tournament 2
121728.description:
Smash Court Tennis Pro Tournament 2 is a tennis game created by Namco for the PlayStation 2.

The game features many playable modes including Arcade mode and the in depth Pro Tour mode in which you create a player and try to become a tennis champion. Other modes include Exhibition, Challenge and Tutorial. There are a range of courts one can play on, including those at the Australian Open (the old Rebound Ace courts), Roland Garros, Wimbledon and the U.S. Open.

Smash Court Tennis Pro Tournament 2 contains 16 real top tennis players. The players included in the game are:

ATP Players
United States Andy Roddick - Power Serves
Spain Juan Carlos Ferrero - Strong Forehand
United Kingdom Tim Henman - Serve And Volley

WTA Players

France Amélie Mauresmo - Hard Hitter
United States Jennifer Capriati - Baseliner
Slovakia Daniela Hantuchová - All Around

The game also includes secret characters from Namco's popular game series Tekken and Soul Calibur. These characters are:
Ottoman Empire Cassandra Alexandra - Serve And Volley
China Ling Xiaoyu - Baseliner
Japan Heihachi Mishima - Power Player
France Raphael Sorel - Fast Strokes

Source: Wikipedia, "Smash Court Tennis Pro Tournament 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121729.name: Smash Court Tennis Pro Tournament
121729.description:
Smash Court Tennis Pro Tournament is a video game created by Namco for the PlayStation 2.

Smash Court Tennis Pro Tournament contains 8 real top tennis players. The players included in the game are:

ATP Players
United States Pete Sampras
United States Andre Agassi
Australia Patrick Rafter
Russia Yevgeny Kafelnikov

WTA Players
Russia Anna Kournikova
Switzerland Martina Hingis
United States Lindsay Davenport
United States Monica Seles

In SCTPT there is a range of courts one can play on, including those at the Australian Open (the old Rebound Ace courts), Wimbledon and the U.S. Open.

Source: Wikipedia, "Smash Court Tennis Pro Tournament", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121730.name: Hi-Rise
121730.description:
User Summary

An action/puzzle game in isometric 3d. The player must paint a building while avoiding workers on strike. Once all the tiles of the current building are painted, an exit to the next level appears.

121731.name: Smash Court Tennis 3
121731.description:
Smash Court Tennis 3 is a tennis video game for the PlayStation Portable and Xbox 360 by Namco Bandai Games. The game features world class tennis players such as Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Justine Henin. The Xbox 360 version of the game featured updated graphics and new gameplay elements such as the ability to choose player emotions. The Xbox 360 version was delayed in all regions until between late August and early September 2008

Challenge the Best: Take on Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal, Justine Henin and other tennis stars. Each of the 16 licensed Pro-Tennis players in-game characters utilizes the unique playing style of the actual player!
More Than Just Rallies: Seven exciting modes, including Arcade mode, Tutorial mode, Exhibition mode, Pro Tour mode, and unique mini-games including Pac-Man tennis, Galaga Tennis and Bomb Tennis!
All New Pro Tour Mode: Acquire new skills, allocate experience points, train for important matches, and receive fan mail, all while on the hunt for the #1 spot on the tour.
Choose how short your shorts really are: Become the player you always wanted to be with the ability to edit your player. Smash Court Tennis 3 features more than twice as many customizable parts as Smash Court Tennis Pro Tournament 2 and Smash Court Tennis Pro Tournament, including sportswear, racquets, and more! Mental elements also play into how your character acts and looks, so stay focused and on your game! The game also features licensed apparel from makers such as Adidas.
It's all about attitude: The Xbox 360 version allows you to choose your players reaction to bad line calls and stunning winners. There are up to eight different emotions to select from after certain points.
New Skills and Shots: Acquire new skills like the ability to increase the speed of hits or the accuracy of serves. By clearing certain conditions in the game, you can acquire powerful new Super Shots like Spin Shot and Running Shot! There are over 50 shots and skills to unlock.
Challenge Your Friends: With game sharing, players can go head-to-head with a friend in versus, play mini-games, and more, even with a single UMD. With more than one UMD, challenge your friends to ranked Ad-hoc matches. On Xbox 360 you can challenge friends in online singles and doubles matches, utilizing Xbox Live.
Selectable Outfits.
You can train in mini-games.
You can make your own character.
You can challenge line calls.

ATP players
Switzerland Roger Federer - All-Rounder
Spain Rafael Nadal - Counter Puncher
Argentina David Nalbandian - All-Rounder
United States James Blake - Hard Hitter
Czech Republic Tomáš Berdych - Big Server
France Gaël Monfils - Baseline Player
Spain Feliciano López - Serve and Volleyer
Italy Andreas Seppi - Baseline Player

WTA players
France Amélie Mauresmo - All-Rounder
Belgium Justine Henin - Powerful Backhand
Russia Maria Sharapova - Hard Hitter
Czech Republic Nicole Vaidisova - Baseline Player
Switzerland Martina Hingis - All-Rounder
Serbia Ana Ivanović - Big Server
India Sania Mirza - Hard Hitter
Netherlands Michaëlla Krajicek - All-Rounder

Source: Wikipedia, "Smash Court Tennis 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121732.name: Dawnssley
121732.description:
User Summary

A budget Gauntlet clone. Thor the Warrior and Hobbo the Elf have been captured and must escape Dawnssley. They have to fight monsters, destroy monster generators, pick up keys to open doors; there are treasures to collect, food and drink to replenish energy, and magic potions that destroy every enemy on screen.

121733.name: Insector Hecti In The Interchange
121733.description:
User Summary

An action/puzzle game in which the player must battle enemy bugs while pivoting tiles. A level is cleared when all the junction tiles have the correct orientation (the game plays a sound each time a tile is rotated to the right position). The player has limited ammunition, some more can be collected by picking up power-ups. Other power-ups include a shield, faster movement...

121734.name: Mall of America Tycoon
121734.description:
Mall of America Tycoon is a business simulation game in which the player must successfully create and run a mall. The mall is based on the real Mall of America in Bloomington, Minnesota. The player must manage the mall's income, store contracts, and special event days in order to create a successful mall.

The player starts out with an empty mall, on which they must develop their mall. Options for building include the normal stores and restaurants, but also other items commonly found in malls, such as benches and small plant life. The mall must be developed in such a way that it is profitable, allowing one to add more items. For example, the player can schedule promotions such as the Day of Discounts to draw more people into the mall. Also, a new attraction at Camp Snoopy, the large amusement park in the center of the mall can help attract more people to the mall.
After the player develops the first area sufficiently, another section of the mall is unlocked. There are sixteen sections which need to be developed, and when the last one is complete, the player has won the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mall of America Tycoon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121735.name: Amuse Gueule
121735.description:
Object of the game is to discover different characters through puzzles.

There are many prominent historical figures: politicians, entertainment, literature, art, real characters, mythical or imaginary, but always with a certain reputation.
Clue to four per person, are arranged on cards, in descending order of difficulty.

If player discovers a character he advances his pawn up to 4 squares on the board. The winner is the player who first reaches the fifth level of the pyramid (in the top easier).

121736.name: Wheel of Fortune Deluxe (PC)
121736.description:
From the box

Spin the Wheel and experience the enhanced game play and vivid graphics of the updated version of America's #1 game show! Pick a consonant or buy a vowel to solve puzzles. Create your own profile and earn trophies along with virtual cash!

121737.name: RollerCoaster Tycoon 2: Triple Thrill Pack
121737.description:
User Summary

Compilation of the complete Rollercoaster Tycoon set, including base game and its two expansions.

121739.description:
English:

TOGETHER WE ARE STRONG!

A game about problems and their solutions for 2 - 4 players.

In our daily lives we are often faced with various problems, which may harm our contentedness and feelings of happiness. These problems may be of bodily, social and/or mental nature. To solve these issues, there are numerous solutions (or at least approaches) and helpful people covering all aspects – bodily, social and mental.

This easy to pick up, educational yet fun-to-play card game tries to recreate these aspects of our living reality in a more or less abstract manner. The game should be a cooperative experience, in which not one is declared winner and the others losers in the end. Not selfishness and only striving for one’s own benefit, but rather helping each other should pave the road to victory. All players win TOGETHER. Nobody should be left behind. Thus the name of the game!

In "Together we are strong!" players cooperate to solve their problems or problems of other players by playing "solution" cards which can be boosted by "helper" cards. At the beginning of his or her turn, the active player draws cards from a shared 60 card deck containing problems, solutions and helpers. For each problem a player solved on his or her own, he or she receives two smiley-chips (Victory Points). If players work together to solve a problem, each player involved gets one smiley-chip. When the draw deck is depleted, all players must have reached a minimum of smiley-chips / Victory Points (depending on the number of players) in order to win the game. If one or more players have not reached that goal, everyone loses.

Developed by a studied social worker, this game is ideal for social workers and other people working in the social sector as well as for people/families who have experience with psychosocial problems, while still providing a pleasant gaming experience for other interested gamers as well.

Français :

L’UNION FAIT LA FORCE !

Un jeu de problèmes et de solutions, pour 2 à 4 joueurs.

Nos vies quotidiennes regorgent de problèmes de toutes natures, psychologiques, relationnels ou physiques, de sorte qu’il n’est pas toujours facile de conserver notre équilibre et notre confiance en nous. Heureusement, nous pouvons recourir à des gens compétents et à des recettes éprouvées pour les surmonter.

Dans ce jeu facile d’accès, éducatif, mais qui n’oublie pas le plaisir, le but est de recréer ces aspects de la vie de façon quelque peu abstraite, et de les combattre tous ensemble, d’où le titre ! Il n’y aura ni vainqueur ni vaincu dans ce défi avant tout coopératif ; l’entraide, et non l’égoïsme, sera la clé de la victoire. Nul ne doit être laissé pour compte !

Les joueurs doivent utiliser et échanger des cartes de Solutions et de Soutiens pour résoudre leurs Soucis et ceux des autres. Chaque problème surmonté rapporte deux pions Sourire, que l’on partage si l’on s’est fait aider par un autre. À la fin de la pioche, chacun doit avoir gagné un minimum de Sourires qui dépend du nombre de joueurs, sinon tout le monde est perdant.

Développé par un professionnel du secteur social, ce jeu sera idéal pour vos collègues, votre famille, ainsi que pour quiconque connaît, ou a connu, des expériences difficiles. Mais tout le monde peut aussi y jouer rien que pour le plaisir.
121739.name: Gemeinsam sind wir stark!

121740.name: Centipede (1998)
121740.description:
Centipede is a remake of the 1980 arcade game of the same name, produced by Atari and designed by Ed Logg and Dona Bailey. This version has multiple in-game innovations, with improved gameplay and graphics. It retains the original idea of shooting the entire centipede repeatedly. The player assumes the role of a futuristic vehicle named "The Shooter", rather than the original garden gnome.
Gameplay consists of a series of "rounds" which are completed once the player eliminates the centipede that winds down the playing field. Obstacles such as spiders, fleas, and scorpions complicate the game. At the same time, a population of mushrooms grows between the player and the centipede.

Source: Wikipedia, "Centipede (1998 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121741.name: Williams Pinball Classics
121741.description:
User Summary

Contains authentic reproductions of four Williams pinball tables:
Lost World
Tales of the Arabian Nights
Black Rose
Creature from the Black Lagoon

121742.name: National Lampoon's Chess Maniac 5 Billion and 1
121742.description:
From the box

The Chess Maniac can kick your butt...or you'll kick his. Sure he plays real chess, from novice to master level. But that lunatic, the Chess Maniac, will try anything it takes to win--distracting you with swimming sharks, coy can-can dancers, piddling pooches and much, much more! He'll even cheat if you let him, so keep your eyes peeled! Play with Belly Dancers, Jesters, Wizards, and the rest of their friends on a rotatable 3-D chess board.

121743.name: Timeline for iPad
121743.description:
User Summary:

This is a computer version of the boardgame http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/85256/timeline-inventions

It is a trivia game where the players have a number of cards with discoveries and inventions and they have to play their cards on the table sorting them chronologically.

Of course, the players do not know the date of each event and, after checking the date, if the card is ill-placed they have to draw a new card.

The first player that plays all of his or her cards is the winner.

121744.name: Visions (Issue 02 - 1999)
121744.description:
Regulars

•News - More on the latest releases in the RPG world from Aberaant through Sengoku to the world of flowers on Nobilis
•Small Worlds - What's it like to be a figures sculptor? We interview Citadel miniatures artist Chirs Fitzpatrick on how he does
•News Decks - It's judgement day, creeps. The new Judge Dredd card game hits the streets, lawmasters and all. Plus a CCG for teen girls- frightening
•Paper cuts - This month labour-of-love budget B&W's get the treatment as we explore a new realm of mono-magic panel art and stories
•Live Show - New Name, OmegaLRP, gets an event review, news of Chimera's many events; Braveheart's brother plus news of second skin
•Critical Hits - Three worthwhile novels with excellent opportunities for RPGs plus books to get the conspiracists looking into the sky
•Electric Theatre -Checking out Baldur's gate and silver - not real RPG, but could be fun
•USA News - News on what's going on across the pond with the big business takeovers and buy-outs of RPG companies in the US of A
•Dork Tower - Get your fix of the most popular cartoon strip dedicated to the players of RPGs

Features

•Walk on the Wild Side - Jacked in and burned out? Try something a bit different and get you adventure au naturelle. Nathan Gribble presents role-playing with you as the beasties - whether you want to be a frightened bunny or Mr Toad
•What's in the box? - Swash your buckle in this piratical LRP adventure for any system featuring stone Trolls, Dark Elevs and the Rose o' the mists
•A kind of magic - Our series continues with a look at the oldest type of real magic: Shamanism. And we see how they fit into RPGs of all varieties.
•Storm from the East - An Ars Magica scenario incorporating the powers of shamanism in the war between the Mongols and the western powers
•Gardening for beginners -An interview with writer Steven Erikson after the publication of his first fantasy novel "Gardens of the Moon"

121745.name: Battles of 1861
121745.description:
Scenario expansion for the Cheer Boys Cheer ruleset for the American Civil War. Four battles, all fought in 1861, with orders of battle, historical background, maps, rules and historical outcomes. Scenarios consist of:

Blackburn's Ford
Buck Hill
Greenbrier River
Belmont

121746.name: Battles of 1862
121746.description:
Scenario expansion for the Cheer Boys Cheer ruleset for the American Civil War. Four battles, all fought in 1862, with orders of battle, historical background, maps, rules and historical outcomes. Scenarios consist of:

Mill Springs
Oak Grove
Parker's Crossroads
Richmond

121747.name: Battles of 1864
121747.description:
Scenario expansion for the Cheer Boys Cheer ruleset for the American Civil War. Four battles, all fought in 1864, with orders of battle, historical background, maps, rules and historical outcomes. Scenarios consist of:

Olustee
New Market
Mine Creek
Morton's Ford

121748.name: Le Tigre Et Les Chevres
121748.description:
User Summary

A computer adaptation of the Nepalese boardgame Bagh Chal: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/315/bagh-chal

The game can be played against the computer or a human opponent.

121749.name: Le Jeu Du Roy
121749.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the classic game Tablut: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/33691/tablut

3 difficulty levels, and 3 different opponents.

121750.name: Adventure 1: The Mountain Keep (fan expansion to HeroQuest)
121750.description:
The Game of Hero Quest lives on in these new adventure series of games. Each adventure is a single story that are 14 quests long. The Heroes start out with their beginning status and build up their strength as they fight their way through each castle. In the end they must have a fight with Zargon to survive. Will they succeed?
These games' pdf files are available for downloading. They are made in a way that will allow you to make the books and cards. The pages are available at "Dragonkingdoms.co.uk" and yahoo's group site "Hero Quest Game board" for free. You do need to join the group to access the file's section where they are stored. The photo section of this site will allow you to read the story and look at the maps to see if this game is something you would like to play. Your adventure awaits!

121751.description:
Somewhere nearby is Colossal Cave, where it is rumored that others have found fortunes in treasure and gold. Magic, too, is said to work in the cave. But beware! Some who enter are never seen again...

Colossal Cave: The Board Game is an adaptation of the classic text adventure "Colossal Cave Adventure". The basic game mechanism is "draw one, play one"; there is also a game board depicting a simplified map of the cave (14 rooms). Cards represent items, treasures, actions, and "reactions"; you're generally not allowed to play an item or treasure card unless your player token is in a specific room on the map. For example, the Rare Coins are not playable anywhere except in the Hall of the Mountain King. After you play a treasure, you must get it safely back to the surface, where you can deposit it in the Well House.

The winner is the first player to deposit three treasures in the Well House. Depending on the number of players and their willingness to stymie each other from the beginning, a game can last anywhere from 20 to 90 minutes.
121751.name: Colossal Cave: The Board Game
boardgameexpansion: Colossal Cave: The Board Game – Back Promo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 40 - Cadets, Cards and Caves

121752.name: Total Strategy: Z, Arena of Combat
121752.description:
Total Strategy is a 2 player strategy game.

Both players take control of an army of 32 units in the arena. The armies are made up of 12 different types of unit including infantry, cavalry, chariots and war elephants. Each unit has its own strengths and weaknesses so a careful balance of strategy is required to be a successful general.

The object of the game is to out maneuver your opponent and capture their general.

The game-play is historically realistic, players can use maneuvers from classic battles directly in the game to improve their chances of victory. This level of realism makes the game both easy to learn yet deceptively difficult to master.

Players take it in turns to move all their pieces, moving and attacking. Play then passes to their opponent. The winner of each attack is decided by the combat pot. The game finishes when one player captures the opponents general.

As with all Total Strategy Games the game is designed to be customisable by the players once they become proficient.

121753.name: Black Mirror II: Reigning Evil
121753.description:
A traditional point and click, 3rd-person adventure game.

From the game box:

Twelve years ago, an unspeakable darkness was banished from Black Mirror Castle... or so they thought!

When Darren Michaels, a loner in a small New England village befriends Angelina, a beautiful woman that has attracted the eye of several others, he has no idea what fate has in store for him. When Angelina suddenly disappears, Darren is haunted by a series of terrifying nightmares. Questioning his own sanity, he sets out in search of his friend on a chilling expedition across the Atlantic that will lead him to Black Mirror Castle, in England.

Darren's journey will immerse him in the dark secrets and turbulent history of the castle's ill-fated Gordon Family. Legend has it that the Gordon's were haunted by an ancient curse that ultimately led to their demise more than a decade earlier. Will Darren be able overcome these demons and find Angelina? Or will he become the curse's next victim?

Will Darren's search lead him to redemption or the hell of insanity? The answers can only be found in the Black Mirror - for once you gaze into it, you won't be able to look away.

- A rich captivating game world
- An epic story of evil told in six chapters
- Atmospheric effects such as rain, fog, and storms
- More than 40 characters
- Hundreds of realistic animations
- Challenging puzzles and mini-games
- Over 100 different locations including a medieval underground temple, and a cemetery

121754.name: BBQ Blitz!
121754.description: Grab a spatula! In this childrens' dexterity game, players race to flip burger patties in order to collect toppings shown on the underside of the patties. Once the four burger/topping combinations have been collected, players gather buns to top their burgers. The first player to complete their four burgers wins!

boardgamecompilation: Cartoona: Expansions – includes Heads on Tails and Long Necks
121755.description:
In this zany expansion, Cartoona creatures can become even stranger!

It includes six neck tiles that can be placed in-between a head tile and a front body tile. These neck tiles can be placed even when the head and body have already been connected! They can also be stacked on top of one another for some seriously long necks!

Neck tiles can also be placed on the creatures of your opponents in an attempt to disrupt single-color creature scoring, or give negative points with the "crick in the neck" tile.

Below are the neck tiles included in the expansion:

One yellow and purple dual-color neck, worth six points
One yellow crick in the neck, worth -3 points
One magenta neck with Adam's apple, worth 4 points
One blue neck with a collar, worth 5 points
One wavy magenta neck worth 3 points
One straight magenta neck, worth 3 points




Four new cards will come with the expansion including:

One "remove neck" tile card
One "steal neck" tile card
One "-4 pain in the neck" card and
One "use a neck as any leg or tail" tile card
121755.name: Cartoona: Long Necks Expansion

121756.name: Funny Faces
121756.description:
The best face wins the game!

In Funny Faces, players take turns drawing a card and making a face that matches the illustration on that card. The other players then race to place their token on the tile on the gameboard that best matches the first player's expression. The player who correctly guesses the match collects the card. First player to collect three cards wins!

121757.name: Le Tresor De L'Amazone
121757.description:
User Summary

A simple maze game in which the player explores the Amazonian jungle looking for diamonds.

121758.name: Guerre Des Galaxies
121758.description:
User Summary

A simple space wargame, inspired by the Star Trek TV series. The player controls a spaceship and fights battles on a grid-based map.

121759.name: Locomotion
121759.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game in which the player(s) must build railroad tracks by shifting tiles around like in a sliding puzzle. The train proceeds along the tracks while the player is building them (though the train can be stopped for up to one minute per level).

121761.name: Lost Caves
121761.description:
User Summary

A Boulder Dash clone, with a few tweaks: doors, bombs, one-way passages, remotely activated doors, potions taht protect against enemies or rockfalls...

The game has 16 levels.

121762.name: M'Enfin
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121762.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the boardgame Clue, themed around the adventure of Gaston Lagaffe, a famous Belgian comic book character. Gaston's Gaffophone (an apocalyptic musical instrument he invented) has been sabotaged. Police agent Longtarin is investigating the case, but Gaston leads his own parallel investigation.

One player against the computer, or two players.

121763.name: The Hatchings
121763.description:
User Summary

The Hatchings is a action game where you control a hen who is continuously laying eggs. Once laid legs will pop out of the eggs and they run around. Contacting an egg causes it to hatch and creates an area effect which hatches nearby eggs. For the highest score you will want to avoid contact with eggs until a great density of eggs comes together and all hatch at once. The goal is to score as many points as you can in the time limit.

121764.description: In Plato 3000, a revised and improved version of the print-and-play game Utopian Rummy, players have the opportunity to rebuild the world into a new utopia. Players take turns playing sets of Job cards, shaping the new world, and giving them powers to break the rules of the game. Other players can join in – adding their matching Job cards – to gain the power for their side and lay more cards of their own.
121764.name: Plato 3000

121765.name: Little Deviants
121765.description:
Join the Little Deviants in a series of madcap adventures that allow you to have fun discovering and experimenting with the new PS Vita functions - including rear touch, front touch, six-axis motion senors, front and rear cameras and microphone.

Fun-filled mini-games showcase all the interactivity features of PlayStation®Vita – including augmented reality shooting action with Botz Invasion, or tilt and lean your way through Gravity Cave with the six-axis motion feature
Work with the Little Deviants to boost your scores and move up to the top of the online leaderboards
Play alone or with up to 8 players via Pass Around multiplayer mode.

Source: The Game Website.

121766.description:
Glory to Rome: Republic Expansion has been in the making since 2007 or thereabouts, and with the publication of the Black Box edition of Glory to Rome in 2012, it has finally become an official variant/expansion. (The Republic Expansion is included with GtR Black Box; this card set makes the expansion available to those who own older editions of the game.)

Playing with the Republic rules, players will find Glory to Rome a bit more forgiving (especially to new players) and more balanced in regard to the Craftsman/Architect roles. The Republic Expansion includes 15 cards:


Crane (x6), which replaces the Circus and allows you to use a card to lead or follow Architect.
Domus Aurea (x3), which replaces the Coliseum and lets you demolish incomplete buildings with no materials when performing the Legionary role.
Forum Romanum (x3), which replaces the Forum and allows for an instant win if you have one client of each type and one material of each type in the stockpile.
Tribunal (x3), which replaces the Senate and allows you to draw one Jack when performing the Thinker role.


When using the Republic Expansion, players start with five order cards in hand (instead of four order cards and a Jack). Players may also Petition with two cards of the same role instead of three.
boardgameversion: Cambridge Games Factory New Art first edition
121766.name: Glory to Rome: Republic Expansion

121767.name: The Marbians
121767.description:
The Marbians have crash landed in Roswell, New Mexico and need your help to get them home in this retro, marble-themed puzzle game. Fling and Flick the marble-encased aliens through 72 puzzling levels to get them back to their UFOs and on their way home!

The Marbians is a physics-based interactive game, where players will send Marbians careening off walls and around obstacles to collect moon rocks, rack up points and bonuses, and reach their UFO homes. Smack your Marbian off walls at high speed for more points, collect all the moon rocks you can, and see your alien friends safely home! Post your high scores and trophies to your Facebook page, and check the global rankings for each level to see how you stack up with the rest of the marble-flinging world.

Source: The Game Website.

121768.name: QuBIT
121768.description:
In the game, you play a mining robot called QuBIT, who has been dispatched across the galaxy to mine precious crystalline elements by smashing into them at high speed. QuBIT controls a team of excitable mini-bots called QuBs, which fly in formation around him and capture the crystal energy. As you score higher, the MoTHER ship will beam down more QuBs to join the action. Watch out for your energy though, when you run out, the mission is over and you will be beamed back to MoTHER.

Source: The Game Website.

121769.name: Battle Slugs
121769.description:
User Summary

In this two-player strategy game, each player takes command of a slug army on a variety of hexagonal fields. Each slug can either clone itself into an adjacent cell, or leap to an empty space. With each move, all neighboring slugs are converted to the active player's color. The goal is to take over the entire field.

This game began as a Facebook game but later moved to iOS.

121770.name: NBA All-Star Challenge
121770.description:
This game offers a chance to compete in one-on-one basketball with legendary NBA superstars like Michael Jordan (Chicago Bulls), David Robinson (San Antonio Spurs), Larry Bird (Boston Celtics), and even Patrick Ewing (New York Knicks). Every mode is multiplayer-capable in addition to being selectable for single-player gameplay.

Playing modes available to the players include: H-O-R-S-E, a free throw tournament, a shooting contest involving three-point shots, and a tournament where one NBA player will take on other NBA players for the ultimate prize. All fouls are called in this game; including minor fouls like goaltending. The winner of each match has a screen with a set of game statistics. Even the offer of a rematch is offered once a game is over.

Players are not chosen by name. Instead, they are chosen by their team (as of the 1991–92 NBA season). This will confuse fans who are unfamiliar of professional basketball from the late 1980s/early 1990s. Vital statistics related to gameplay are also included here like height, weight, the number of points that the player scores in a typical game, and accuracy in percentage for various shots.

Source: Wikipedia, "NBA All-Star Challenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121771.name: Three Kingdoms TD: Fate of Wei
121771.description:
User Summary

A tower defense game based on the Three Kingdoms period in Chinese history. The setting is somewhat unique in the tower defense genre, and the story is told through still images and occasional pseudo-cutscenes. The gameplay, however, is traditional: enemies proceed along a snaking path, and you must places buildings and units, each of which you can upgrade.

121772.name: Earth Under Siege
121772.description:
Mankind is threatened! All major cities and countries were destroyed by bloodthirsty, powerful aliens. All nations must put aside their differences in a last effort for survival. 8 state-of-the-art hatches are built in key territories of the planet, equipped with the most destructive technologies ever developed. 8 types of cannons under only one command, in a desperate attempt at retaliation. What lies ahead is the most fantastic and deadly war the world has ever seen.

Source: The Game Website.

121773.name: Nicky Boum
121773.description:
The player controls 'Nicky', a little boy who embarks on an adventure through a fantastical land to free his grandfather from dungeon of the evil witch Zoldrane, who tries to force him to help her in making of a terrible spell.

Gameplay

Nicky can walk, jump, and throw apple cores to defend himself against Zoldrane's monstrous minions. The player can pick up other items to throw at enemies, such as bouncy balls and logs that can be also used to build bridges at certain parts of the levels. Nicky is able to jump on enemies to kill them, which is often more difficult but lets the monsters drop point items to collect. The game consists of eight levels based on four separate themes, including a swamp, a forest and the witch's castle.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nicky Boum", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121775.name: Travel Monopoly
121775.description:
A travel-sized version of Monopoly, with all of the pieces of the standard game (including Chance and Community Chest cards), just smaller, unlike Monopoly: The Portable Property Trading Game, which has some game play differences, such as using three dice and a chart rather than Chance and Community Chest cards.

Gameplay

On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail.

Goal

The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.

121776.name: Miniature Table Football
121776.description:
Seven-a-side miniature version of the bar-football games you see in pubs or clubs.

Each player stands at halfway, on opposite sides of the board. Once the ball is in play, both try to swivel their players (using levered handles on their side), to kick the ball into their opponent's goal. This game tends to get more frantic as the game progresses.

121777.name: Miniature Air Football
121777.description:
A home version of the arcade game where you use flippers to send the ball to the opposite end of the pitch. This is a reduced size so that it can easily be played on a table.

Both players stand at opposite ends of the pitch. Put the ball in play and frantic flipping becomes the order of the day. Whoever scores the most goals, wins.

121778.name: Miniature Air Hockey
121778.description:
A home version of the arcade game where you use flippers to send the puck to the opposite end of the rink. This is a reduced size so that it can easily be played on a table.

Both players stand at opposite ends of the rink. Put the puck in play and frantic flipping becomes the order of the day. Whoever scores the most goals, wins.

121779.name: Jeu des Sixties
121779.description:
The Game of the Sixties is the game of questions, mimes, songs or drawings.

The box comes in the form of a jukebox: the outcome of the dice indicates the category with which we will play. Mostly, this is to answer questions, but sometimes you need to make small fun events. We can then find themselves dancing the twist, to mime or sketch a profile of a star.

121780.description:
Yards is a two-player football-themed strategy board game. The game begins where the most exciting football games end: it is sudden-death overtime, and the first team to score a touchdown or field goal wins. The game is played in drives in which players alternate driving the ball towards opposite ends of the field.

Players are dealt cards with simple patterns on them, and then set up their pieces in formations of their choice on opposite sides of a line of scrimmage. Each player, on their turn, may then choose to move one piece one space, or move several pieces at a time--but only if the pieces on the field match the patterns on the card. The pattern cards may be rotated and combined to set up dramatic breakaway plays, but only if they can outwit the defense.

Playtime is approximately 30 minutes. Ages 10 and up. Solitaire variant also available.
121780.name: Yards: The Game of Inches

121781.name: Another Rainy Night
121781.description:
From the publishers website:

Shadowrun: Enhanced Fiction: Another Rainy Night

Blood Runs Red

Every day in the Sixth World people die in a thousand different ways. Every day blood is spilled. Every place that rain falls, it washes away some of the red that stains the streets.

Eliminating every killer in the Sixth World is as impossible as drying up every raindrop in a storm, but Thomas McAllister doesn’t want to get rid of all of them. Just one. He’s been on this killer’s trail for a while, and he knows he’s getting closer. The only question is if he’ll be able to handle getting as close as he’s about to be, or if his blood will join the stream that regularly flows into the gutters of the sprawls.

Another Rainy Night is part of Shadowrun's enhanced fiction line. It contains an original short story, along with game information to use elements of the story in your game, including stats for the major characters and new gear introduced in the story. Gamemasters and players can do more than become immersed in the fiction—they can make it a part of their gaming world.

Another Rainy Night is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

121782.name: Chef d'Orchestre
121782.description:
6 violins, 4 violas, 3 cellos, 2 basses, 5 Wind Instruments, 5 Percussion cards, 4 Brass, and even a harp and a piano are gathering for a harmonious concert.

You draw a card and put in front of you. You replay if you draw an instrument of a family You already have.
There are also 3 special cards in this game:
The conductor can take a card from another player.
Phone and alarm clock are not good for the ears and You lose a card!

Try to collect similar families and take pleasure in having the full Philharmonic Orchestra to win the game.

Contents:

31 large cards representing the instruments,
3 special cards: conductor / alarm clock / mobile

121783.description:
Cardgame based on Kemps

There are 4 different type of cards with Italian characters, and two cards for each player: Meals served and Bad food. You must collect 4 cards of the same family of Italians by changing the cards with opponents. You need to define a sign with Your partner and when this sign is done, your partner will then play the card "Meals served". But if opponent's team play the card "Bad food" before this they score a point instead Your team.
121783.name: La Mamma

121786.description:
Game description from the publisher:

With over 100 Adventure Cards, plus new spells, characters, and alternative endings, Talisman: The Blood Moon Expansion adds a gripping layer of gothic horror to your quest for the Crown of Command.

In addition to a host of new challenges, including a bloodthirsty Werewolf that prowls the land, time alternates between "Day" and "Night" under The Blood Moon. The new Time Card flips between its Day and Night sides to indicate the inexorable passage of time. Whenever a player draws one or more Events on his turn, he flips the Time Card, a seemingly minor change with a range of game-altering consequences. Whereas creatures are slightly weaker in the cold light of day, they grow bolder at nightfall.

What's more, a number of new Adventure Cards have varied effects depending on the time of day; the night can usher in the Witching Hour, during which spells are more prevalent...or a thick Moon Mist can descend on the land, inhibiting safe travel until dawn.
121786.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Blood Moon Expansion

121787.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In a galaxy far far away, there is a planetary system composed of a great big sun and nine minor planets, four of which have been developed as mercantile planets more or less under the control of politicians and guilds. On each of these planets are a merchant guild, a guild of smugglers, a bazaar and the galactic government, and players can take special actions on each of these planets.

In RYŪ, a game of negotiation, bluffing and cube-drafting, players each represent one of the other five planets in this star system, with each planet having a different type of humanoid – such as sharks, amazons and meka goblins – and its own unique influences. These planets are open to prospecting, and with the proper financing players will be able to dig the resources they need to build their own RYŪ, a mother ship composed of "Rare Metal", "Memory Stone", and "Amber Magic". Players will need to cooperate with one another to raise the necessary resources, but they must also work for themselves in order to maintain an advantage over other players. Once assembled, the RYŪ comes to life as a living spaceship, and its owner wins the game.

Probable update from game box on publisher website:

Several centuries ago, a celestial Leviathan cried on Titan, our planet. Its tears flooded our cities and our land. The people of the Dragons did their utmost to save as many of us as they could: Goblins, Shibuke, Reptilians, Sharks, and Amazons. The survivors of this deluge were brought to Dala, the highest mountain range of our celestial body, with its 9 majestic summits. Nine summits that soon became nine islands.
121787.name: RYŪ
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep. 13.5 Board Game Blitz
Ep. 15 3D Printing & Negotiation
Vox Republica 094: The CR At Gen Con 2015 - Part 1
Vox Republica 110: Pandemic, Patchwork, and Patreon

121788.name: Kung-Fu Rush
121788.description:
User Summary

The game involves a series of thrown objects that you must either dodge or break using kicks and punches. It is a very simple game.

121789.name: Smarties: Meltdown
121789.description:
Smarties: Meltdown is a third person game, apparently aimed at young children. The game is set on a giant Nestlé Smartie shaped factory ship which orbits the Earth. Dr. Soursweet is the main villain in the game, who aims to take over the Smarties factory. The main hero, the character played by the player, is Big Blue, who must battle to save the factory and the Smarties.

To do this, Big Blue has to explore the different areas of the factory, saving individual Smarties and destroying "Stroopers" - Dr. Soursweet's evil sugary creations. Big Blue must also find permanent upgrades, which improve various aspects of Big Blue and his "exosuit" (the suit in which he uses to run, shoot and jump). Some of the upgrades include "Choco Ray", which fires a blast of chocolate (with enough blasts, you can destroy Stroopers), and "Half Chocolate Jacket", which offers temporary protection against enemy fire.

Big Blue's exosuit runs on energy, which needs to be replaced after it is used up. Energy can be used by speeding up your run or by using the upgrades. Destroying Stroopers provides Big Blue with "energy balls". Big Blue has health and up to five lives - medikits and energy cells can also be found and collected.

The game is quite open-ended, with most levels containing large areas with plenty of Smarties to find. Most areas need you to collect a certain number of Smarties before you can access them, providing a challenge for younger players. There are a few different gameplay styles but these repeat themselves throughout the game. The entire game mostly has a 'platform' gameplay style, but there are some more action/adventure touches to certain parts of the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Smarties: Meltdown", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121790.description:
In the tile-placement, mine-building game Mines of the Sacred Dragon, players take turns building mines or expanding existing mines in order to score victory points (VPs). When a player has 0-1 mine tokens remaining or the draw pile is depleted, the game ends after the final player has finished his turn.

Players then score points – one VP for each solitary mine, with extra points for connecting mines – and the player with the most points wins. In case of a tie, the player with the larger set of connecting mines wins; if tied again, the tied player who took the later turn wins.
121790.name: Mines of the Sacred Dragon
boardgameexpansion: Mines of the Sacred Dragon: Promo Exp Set #1
Mines of the Sacred Dragon: Tile Exp Set #1
Mines of the Sacred Dragon: Tile Exp Set #2
Mines of the Sacred Dragon: Tile Exp Set #3

121791.name: Smuggler's Run 2: Hostile Territory
121791.description:
Smuggler's Run 2: Hostile Territory is a video game released for the PlayStation 2. It is a sequel to the game Smuggler's Run. Like the first game the player is a smuggler trying to deliver illegal cargo to destinations within 3 large maps in the game using several different types of vehicles to make deliveries in a given amount of time.

The game was originally supposed to take place in Afghanistan but following the attacks on the World Trade Center and the subsequent invasion of Afghanistan, the developers changed the Afghanistan levels to the deserts of Georgia, Soviet/Russia instead.

Similar to the original game, the overall objective in most missions is to deliver illegal contraband from a pick-up to a drop-off spot in a given amount of time. The player would also have to avoid local army and border patrol during these missions. Now, players will also have to follow vehicles without being seen, destroying enemy vehicles, and evading police after all other objectives are finished. The player will be given a number of vehicles to choose from. There are the following game modes:

Smuggler's missions Turf war -- Within this is Crooks 'n Smugglers, Loot Grab and Bomb Tag Checkpoint Races Joyridin' Bonus Missions.

he game takes place in three locations with the player working for a small smuggling company named Exotic Imports (EI or EXO for short). The story focuses on the activities and objectives given by The Colnel to EI. It starts in Russia, where the player finds out who they are working for and the basics of the game. Then, after being told to leave immediately from the area by Shodi (The main client) to Vietnam, Exotic Imports then learns of the CIA being involved after the Russians track 2 KG of Weapons Grade Plutonium. This takes you back to Russia, where Frank (Your Boss) asks the Colnal what is happening with the "nukes" and involvment from the CIA. Frank, only caring for money, agrees to continue smuggling nuclear devices. However, the rest of EI decide not to, and try to stop a missile which would cause WWIII. This reveals the Colnels intentions, and Frank escapes with all the passwords, showing his plans. EI stop Frank, and then it shows the player flying off in a helicopter with a cheque for $100,501,000.

Source: Wikipedia, "Smuggler's Run 2: Hostile Territory", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121792.name: Match Point
121792.description:
In Matchpoint, the first title in The Game Master's "Smart & Fun" game line, players take turns placing one of two tiles in hand onto the playing area, turning the tile this way and that to determine the best way to earn the most points.

More specifically, each tile is comprised of four colored quadrants, with each quadrant having a number of pips: purple has five pips, blue has four, and so on. One tile is placed face-up on the table at the start of the game. On a turn, you place a tile next to tiles already in play, then score the sum of all pips in the colored areas that you add to with the placed tile. (In the advanced version of the game, you multiply the sum of all pips by the number of colors that you matched on that turn.) You then draw a replacement tile, and the next player takes her turn. whoever has the most points when the tiles run out wins!

The rules also include a solo variant.

121793.description:
In Sharks with Lasers, you are a special agent trainee trying to pass an extremely dangerous field exam in order to claim your rightful place in the Mysterious Intelligence Agency (MIA). In this field exam, you are dropped into the fearsome depths of cold, dark waters and your goal is to reach a nearby island… alive. To obstruct any special agent trainee foolish enough to try and pass the exam an army of sharks equipped with lasers has been unleashed in the waters. You and your comrades are all in for a hell of a swim, as you dash for the island and your safety. Are you skilful enough to avoid getting blasted or worse, shredded by one of the fishy monstrosities? Fortunately, you brought along something to help you achieve your ridiculous mission: N’s little science project, a shark-with-laser-dazer. N’s device is capable of controlling the utterly dangerous sharks with lasers and it even comes with a built-in laser shield. That N, isn’t such a nerd after all.
