Sharks with lasers is a fast paced boardgame, where players secretly play movement cards to move their agent. In addition, they jointly control the sharks, by secretly playing movement cards on the sharks. The game is played in rounds of which each consists of playing cards and subsequently resolving agent and shark movement. The first player who reaches the island alive, passes the special agent field exam, wins the game and becomes part of the special agent elite of the MIA.
121793.name: Sharks with Lasers

121794.name: Sonic Riders: Zero Gravity
121794.description:
Sonic Riders: Zero Gravity released in Japan as Sonic Riders Shooting Star Story (ソニックライダーズ シューティングスターストーリー Sonikku Raidāzu Shūtingu Sutā Sutōrī), is a hoverboard racing video game published by Sega and developed by Sonic Team in cooperation with NowPro. It is the fifth racing game in the Sonic the Hedgehog franchise, following Sonic Drift, Sonic Drift 2, Sonic R and its predecessor, Sonic Riders.

Sonic Riders: Zero Gravity was only available on the PlayStation 2 and Wii video game systems. The PS2 version was not released in Japan. A sequel titled Sonic Free Riders was released on November 4, 2010 exclusively for Kinect on Xbox 360.

The Story is split into two halves, the Heroes Story (Team Sonic), and Babylon Story (Babylon Rogues). Although the stories start separately, they overlap each other, telling the story as the main characters within that story see it. Following the format of Sonic Riders, Babylon Story also includes an epilogue that expands past the Heroes Story.

Sonic, Tails, and Knuckles are alerted to robots that are attacking a famous city of the future. They set out to retrieve a legendary artifact that has the ability to control gravity. Along the way they discover surprises, including the Babylon Rogues, a group of avian thieves who are also after the artifact. This sets off a war to decide who gets the artifact, leading them to settle their dispute by having an Extreme Gear competition.

This game introduces many new abilities in addition to ones from the first game. By gaining gravity points through tricks and technical challenges, players will enter a zero-gravity zone and be able to perform new moves.

The first is the Gravity Dive, which sucks the player towards a black hole further down the track, giving them a speed boost which tosses cars and other objects off the track and into the air which characters are able to smash into to gain more speed, and Gravity Control, which changes the gravity of the course, allowing the player to use a different track, such as one of the walls.

Also in the game is a move called Gravity Drift. This move is similar to the Grip move in Sonic Riders in which it can help characters turn on tight corners.

Items can offer help the player, such as an attack boost, or cause hardships, such as a ball-and-chain that hooks on your gear and slows your speed down.

There is a new method in the game called "Gear Change". Once you gain a certain amount of rings, your gear will gain an upgrade. Each gear has from zero to three upgrades and can be upgraded during a race. Some upgrades include modifying your Extreme Gear's look or top speed. There are many different board types to use as well, adding for many options for customization.

In Sonic Riders: Zero Gravity, there are three new modes added to the game: Survival Mode, Survival Relay, and Survival Ball. Survival Mode entails each player to pick up missiles, then lock on and launch them at foes with Gravity Control, the winner being the last person standing. Survival Ball mode is, simply put, a soccer game on Extreme Gear. In Survival Relay, 2-4 players make a team of two and do a relay, with Extreme Gear as the baton.

There are a total of 16 courses in the game, eight worlds with two tracks in each. The tracks appear in the order they appear in the story mode.

Megalo Station/Nightside Rush
Botanical Kingdom/Snowy Kingdom
MeteorTech Premises/MeteorTech Sparkworks
Aquatic Capital/Tempest Waterway
Gigan Rocks/Gigan Device
Crimson Crater/Security Corridor
Astral Babylon/Mobius Strip
80's Boulevard/90's Boulevard

Each different type of gear has their own special advantages.

Boards with the Grind upgrade and Skates are able to use the Grind Rails as a shortcut. Although boards must install the Grind upgrade themselves, Skates can already Grind from the start. Besides this, they are predominant in speed, and usually have no other functions.

Air Riders and Yachts are able to use the Launch Ramps as a shortcut. Although Air Rider Gears usually come with no special advantages, the Yacht Type Gears can ride on drafts, which is completely different from Turbulance. By tailgating an opponent, a Yacht will gradually speed up to the point where they pass the opponent. However, their major drawback is that without a draft, Yachts are very slow, generally below 130 MPH.

Bikes and Wheels are able to smash obstacles to create new pathways. Although most Bikes don't come with any additional advantages, Wheels come with a major advantage of the ability to drift.

Some Gears have no Gear Parts, but usually come in the form in the other Gears listed above. However, sometimes, they have extra abilities that help you proceed in the race. For instance, the Money Crisis Gear is a Wheel Type that has no extra upgrades, but increases speed for the more rings you collect.

The Chaos Emerald Gear is a unique gear that can only be used by Sonic. It can only be obtained after you complete all of the missions with an Extreme rank. The Chaos Emerald has no initial Skill and uses rings instead of GP. However, using Gravity Moves consumes rings during at an extremely high rate. When Sonic's rings run out, he reverts back to regular Sonic, and is forced to run the track on foot until he obtains some rings. Before obtaining 60 Rings, the Chaos Emerald Gear is just basically Super Sonic on the Blue Star. When Sonic obtains 60 or more rings, he activates his "Super Sonic Boost". In this state, Sonic gets off his board and flies around the track in a comet form. At this time, ring consumption is increased, but Super Sonic flies at 180 MPH and he is practically invincible to all attacks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sonic Riders: Zero Gravity", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121795.name: The Sopranos: Road to Respect
121795.description:
The Sopranos: Road to Respect is based on the HBO series The Sopranos, which aired from January 10, 1999 to June 10, 2007. It was released on November 7, 2006. The game's storyline takes place between the fifth and sixth seasons and centers around Big Pussy Bonpensiero's illegitimate son, Joey LaRocca, as he makes his way through the family business. Any further plot synopsis would only include spoilers.

The player is able to take missions from the main characters of the series at certain points in the game. Road to Respect differs from other mob-influenced games in that it is in a linear, story driven action game as opposed to Grand Theft Auto's open-world type gameplay. However, players are able to play Texas Hold 'Em with members of the Family and visit Bada Bing. Unlike the TV show, the game focuses almost exclusively on the Mafia aspect of The Sopranos rather than the blend of family/business/therapy that Sopranos fans have become accustomed to.

Video game cast members include James Gandolfini returning as Tony Soprano, Michael Imperioli returning as Christopher Moltisanti, Steven Van Zandt returning as Silvio Dante, Tony Sirico returning as Paulie Gualtieri, Joseph Gannascoli returning as Vito Spatafore, Vincent Pastore returning as Big Pussy Bonpensiero, and Robert Iler returning as A.J. Soprano. David Chase continues to write for the most part. The main character is voiced by Christian Maelen as Joey LaRocca, who was David Chase's second choice to play Christopher Moltisanti. Other noted actors Monica Keena as Trishelle and Robert Costanzo as Angelo Buscetta. Anthony DeSando, who played Brendan Filone on the series, voices an entirely new character as LaRocca's (Maelen) partner in crime, Reggie.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Sopranos: Road to Respect", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121796.name: The Spiderwick Chronicles
121796.description:
The Spiderwick Chronicles is a video game adaptation of the film of the same name.

The plot line mimics the movie's: When Jared, Simon, and Mallory Grace move into the Spiderwick estate, they discover the late owner's field guide to fairies. They soon discover a hidden world all around them, populated with creatures such as brownies, goblins, and sprites. However, Jared and his family are in grave danger, because Mulgarath, an ogre, wants to steal the book for himself.

The principle playable characters are Jared, Simon, and Mallory, and Thimbletack can be used to explore small areas. Each character has a unique weapon with which to fight against evil creatures. The Grace children can capture Sprites to give them special power-ups. In the Wii version, either the classic controller or the Wii Remote and Nunchuk can be used.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Spiderwick Chronicles (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121797.name: Des princesses et des chevaliers
121797.description:
"Princesses and Knights" in English
Card game on the evolutionary theme of princesses and knights. By assembling the cards by 4, we can reconstruct various skits. The cards are laid on the table. Whoever gets the first card of a sketch can begin. The player may now find next card of this sketch etc. and finish the 4-cards sketch first to win the game.
Contents: 32 cards for eight sketches of four maps (castle courtyard of the castle, tower, dining room - the illustrations are duplicated, once with the characters, once without character), rules.

121798.name: Splashdown
videogamehonor: 2001 D.I.C.E. Racing Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
121798.description:
Splashdown is a water racing game for Xbox and PlayStation 2. It can be played by one or two players. Splashdown is quite similar to Nintendo's Wave Race series. Players take control of a personal water-craft as they race against each other on various courses. Players must pass buoys on the way, and they also must pass them on the right side of the buoy, or the jet-ski may stall as a penalty.

Soundtrack:
Blink 182 - The Rock Show
New Found Glory - Hit or Miss
Otis - Hold Your Breath
Smash Mouth - All Star
SR-71 - Right Now
Sum 41 - All She's Got
Sum 41 - Rhythms
The Donnas - You'Ve Got A Crush On Me
The Dude - Rock Da Juice
The Groovie Ghoulies - Chupa Cabra
The Groovie Ghoulies - Graceland

Source: Wikipedia, "Splashdown (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121799.name: Racing
121799.description:
The "Formula Fun" management card game.

Adopt the best strategy in order to earn maximum points on the different tracks in the Formula Fun championship.

You'll have to hire pilots depending on market offer and your income, give the best offer for engine and chassis contracts, while managing the unexpected: disqualified pilot, sponsor offer, financial issues, ...

In order to win, you have to use strategy, common sense, bluff and a bit of luck.

During the game, player will put pilots, chassis and motors in a public market and bid their money (20 million dollars in the beginning) depending on the value of the card.
Sponsors will be put into play without bidding, but no more than 2 sponsors per player.

Each turn, a player may play a circuit in order to start a race.
The race is only a comparison between the cards' value of each player, with the biggest total gaining the first place in the race and thus the best score.

Buy the best cards in order to win the races and earn points to win the game!

121800.name: SpongeBob SquarePants: Creature from the Krusty Krab
121800.description:
SpongeBob SquarePants: Creature from the Krusty Krab is a video game that stars SpongeBob SquarePants, his best friend Patrick Star and their enemy Sheldon J. Plankton as they journey to nine different worlds, supposedly, inside the dreams of the characters.

The Wii version was a North American launch title for Wii. It is also the first SpongeBob game released in Japan (Sony PlayStation 2 and Nintendo Wii versions), but was released under the title: "Spongebob" (スポンジ・ボブ Suponjibobu), to mark it as the first video game in the Spongebob series to have a Japanese release.

Players have access to three playable characters during the game, SpongeBob SquarePants, Patrick Starfishman (Patrick Star in superhero form), and Sheldon J. Plankton, and must guide them through nine levels of play in a dreamworld. Four different types of gameplay have been incorporated into the game, known as flying; rampaging; racing and platforming. During flying sections the game sets obstacles one in front of another, and the player must maneuver past them. In most cases, the game will tell the player which way to fly (up, down, left and right). On the Wii, you use the controller like an actual plane control stick. The most common cases of this is when SpongeBob uses his plane to attack a giant-sized Plankton. In rampage levels the player controls a giant sized Plankton and uses special powers and moves to destroy everything in their path. The player's laser's power is indicated by a bar on the right side of the screen, which refills after use. The Wii version features controller movements that respectively activate moves. Racing gameplay is similar to most racing games; it is featured in both the air and the ground's gameplay, fuel must be collected in order to keep the player's vehicle running. The platforming gameplay is spread throughout the game, such as when Plankton must escape from a live Krabby Patty or when Patrick Starfishman saves Bikini Bottom from his evil form, Dreaded Patrick.

Source: Wikipedia, "SpongeBob SquarePants: Creature from the Krusty Krab", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121801.name: Triple Mémo
121801.description:
Similar with Memory

All photos are by Francois Koch. They represent different animals. Children must not find images that look alike, but those that show the same animal.

121802.name: Rush for Berlin
121802.description:
From the cover:

RfG: Rush for Berlin

Will History repeat itself?

Experience the unique real-time strategy that is Rush for Berlin. Set on the European battlefields of World War II, during 1944-45. Your goal is to capture the German capital. This act symbolises the total defeat of the Third Reich...or does it? Will you be victorious for the Allies or will history be rewritten? Time is critical, defeat or be defeated!

121803.name: Anglers Trivia Tournament
121803.description:
"The Lure of This Game Will Hook You on the First Cast!"

Players take turns rolling, moving around the board, and answering trivia questions related to fishing. The winner gets a prize. The players, however, are instructed to determine what that prize will be before game play begins. (The game does not include any prizes itself.)

121804.name: Hidden Mysteries: The Fateful Voyage – Titanic
121804.description:
From back of Wii box:

EXPLORE THE MOST FAMOUS SHIP IN THE WORLD!
Feel the ship dedck creek as you search for hidden objects, decode secret puzzles and solve the greatest sea mystery ever!

20 unique levels allow you to search for clues, solve puzzles, and get to your lifeboat for survival, don't miss a thing!!!
Multiple endings offer a unique experience for everyone in the family as you discover the secrets of the TITANIC!
Discover hidden objects and secret clues!
Easy to use controls and no time limits!





Go on board the infamous Titanic! Explore the beautiful ship as it begins its doomed descent in Hidden Mysteries: The Fateful Voyage – Titanic. Discover helpful items as you make your escape from the ship. Carefully manage your inventory to have the tools you need at your disposal. Find Hidden Objects as you make your way through beautiful rooms that change as the water level rises. Can you survive this historical event?

Beautiful scenery
Fast-paced gameplay
Escape from the Titanic!




Source: The Publisher Website.

121805.name: Proteus
videogamehonor: 2011 IndieCade Best Audio Design of the Year Winner
2012 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2012 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2012 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Debut Game of the Year Nominee
121805.description:
Proteus is a game of pure exploration and discovery, developed by Ed Key with a reactive ambient soundtrack by David Kanaga.

Source: The Game Website.

121806.name: Race to the Treasure!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 68 - Adrenaline
121806.description:
The race is on! Can you beat the Ogre to the treasure? It's your job to make a path from START to the treasure and collect the three keys that will open the treasure's locks before the Ogre gets there. Strategize, cooperate, and build the path together.

Children as young as two can play this co-operative tile laying game. On their turn, the player draws one tile from the bag, and it will either show a piece of path or picture of the Ogre.

Working together the players need to first make a path to the three keys that open the treasure and then lay a path to the treasure itself. All the while, each Ogre tile gets him closer to the treasure, and the players losing.

Everyone works together on the tile placement and either they win together or lose together.

The game has simple rules and does not require reading, meaning that even kids as young as 2 can be involved.

121807.name: Hidden Mysteries: Buckingham Palace
121807.description:
In Hidden Mysteries: Buckingham Palace you must peel back the curtains on one of the grandest buildings in the western world to look for treasure and uncover its deepest secrets. Learn fun facts about several royal locations while you search for hidden objects and play ingenious mini-games. Follow romantic notes strewn across beautifully rendered scenes in this exciting sequel to Hidden Mysteries: Civil War.

Learn fun royal facts
Use items to solve puzzles
Clever mini-games




Source: The Publisher Website.

121808.name: Starion
121808.description:
User Summary

Starion is part puzzle, part shooter game. Time-travelling aliens have altered history. You are Starion, a rookie space fighter pilot and you must correct the changes the aliens have made. You choose one of the 243 time zones under attack, fight the enemy spaceships in first-person (cockpit) view dogfights, and pick up the letters left behind by the destroyed ships. Once you have cleared the level, you must form a word with the letters you've collected. You then have to cross the time gate and guess what historical event the word refers to. Once that is done, pick another timezone, and the game continues to another dogfight/puzzle sequence.

A game developed by David Webb.

121809.name: Mange Cailloux
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121809.description:
User Summary

A Pengo clone. You must line up three diamonds by pushing them around the level. You can eat the rocks that are in the way (hence the name of the game, which means "rock eater"), or push them away. You also have to evade monsters, or squash them beneath rocks.

121810.name: Le Secret des Moines
121810.description:
The monks go to the gathering around the monastery.

The game board represents a path consisting of multiple branches in boxes. For these cells will spread face down cards representing different plants.

The first player chooses how many spaces it will move. The other players will move the same number of squares in the direction of their choice.
Once on a box, the player becomes aware of the nature of the plant in secret.
- If it appears on his card objective (each player has different objective), he takes it in front of him.
- If it appears on the card of opponent, he places it before him face down.
- If the plant appears nowhere, it stays in place face up.

The first player return to the monastery with its five plants is the winner.

121811.name: The Complete Guide to Role-Playing Games
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
121811.description:
User Summary:

A look at the Role Playing Games available c. 1990, complete with recommendations.

121812.name: Constellations
121812.description:
User Summary

Control a pair of octopi in the sea. The octopi float along the bottom of the screen until you release them, then they shoot upwards. Any starfish touching or between them turn into stars, and score you points. Any orange fish touching or between the octopi negate points for that round. Score as many points as possible within the time limit.

121813.description:
As Marshal of the interstellar fleet, it is your duty to oversee the colonization of nearby regions of the galaxy and thereby ensure the perpetuation of your people at any cost. But your race is not alone in its aspirations for dominance of the cosmos, or in having the power to realize that goal. Races hailing from various star systems venture out in all directions. Many paths are dead ends, but some sectors have sizable deposits of rare minerals that can be refined into the precious fuel crystals that drive your space fleets onward. Soon, a trail of colonies leads out from your homeworld, and soon the races venture into the same cosmic regions. Don’t get too attached to your fleets or interstellar empire, because tides can and will turn quickly. Only you can determine the fate of your people: interstellar conquest or infinite servitude.

StelCon: Infinity is a light strategy war game on a galactic scale. 2-6 players can expect around 30-45 minutes per player, so 2 players can often power through a game in about an hour. The 6 player game is kept short by combining into 3 teams of 2 where the teammates execute their turns simultaneously.

Variable game board. There are 6 races to choose from, each with its own strengths. Although the jump lanes that connect the sectors forming the galactic map are printed on the game boards, each sector location is covered by a different card from the sector deck each game.

Sectors are drawn from the deck and placed as the players explore the galaxy, so you never know what you're going to get...unless you do some scouting with your fighter squads or happen to have some telepaths on board your ship (telepaths are handy that way). Some of the sector cards are identical and therefore also create a "bridge" which is a unique adjacency in addition to the normal jump lanes. All this makes for a very different board every time.

Moving your space fleet around is straight forward. Each ship can move 1 sector per turn, plus 1 extra sector per turn per engine MOD. Your space ships are modular in design, both from a gameplay and a literal perspective. You physically insert engines, extra guns, and fighter squads into holes in the space ships. We call these MODs.

Combat is simple but tense. Add up your firepower present at the battle site and then toss in a d6 roll. The opponent does the same. Compare the two totals, and the winner keeps the sector in question while the loser retreats and loses a ship from his fleet.

While the game is a conquest type game, it ends immediately when one player conquers any homeworld, so there's no eliminated player stuck waiting around for the game to finish.

Conquest cards are the soul of the game. The deck of 120 cards gives tons of gotcha moments, and serious replay value. They allow you to do all sorts of fun things:


Modify the firepower of your sector or your ship
Boost fuel crystal production (the economy of the game)
Steal or stop opponent's cards
Cheat the dice
Wipe out a whole sector
Even influence battles your forces are not involved in, adding an element of table-talking diplomacy to the game
121813.name: StelCon: Infinity

121814.name: Fact or Crap Card Game
121814.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Travel Edition

Take your facts and your crap on the road! Imagination Fact Or Crap Card Game, the famous Hollywood sign once read ‘Hollywoodland’. Fact or Crap? From the day-to-day to the truly bizarre, you just need to just answer: Is it FACT or CRAP? Earn tokens from the bank if you’re right; lose them if you’re wrong. If luck is with you and you’re fast enough, you can earn double tokens in the madcap Rush Hour. The player with the most tokens at the end of the game wins. So, take the challenge, put your thinking cap on and remember it comes down to two words: FACT or CRAP? All new questions, same old fun.

121815.name: Call it! game
121815.description:
From the rules sheet: "Tension triumphs as two to six take turns tossing chips into the can... When you think the target number is reached, CALL IT! Dump out the chips and count 'em up - if you're below, you challenged too soon and you'll lose points - wait too long to challenge, and an opponent may take the round!

Object: To guess when the sum of the numbered chips in the can equals or exceeds the target number announced by the first player in the round"

contents: Can, 6 sets of chips numbered 1-10, score pad, pencil, rules.

121816.name: Creatures of the Tropical Wastes
121816.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Do you need more monsters and mutations for your postapocalyptic, sci-fi, or fantasy game? If so, Creatures of the Tropical Wastes is what you are looking for!
Fully compatible with Mutant Future - as well as Labyrinth Lord and other games that use the familiar and easy-to-use "Basic" role-playing game rules introduced in the 1970s - this collection includes:

- A Foreword by Derek Holland, author of several licensed Mutant Future sourcebooks.
- 50 new creatures, including the mysterious Ahas Folk, the insidious Egret Puppeteer, and the fearsome War Baboy.
- 30 new mutations, including numerous Plant mutations.
- Official Mutant Future Poison and Radiation Tables for convenience of reference.

121817.name: Maze Mania
videogameversion: European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121817.description:
User Summary

An arcade game in which you must paint every tile in a maze the same colour. The game manual says:

"Flippo must travel through the Mazes of the Upper Plane turning the tiles as he goes. Avoiding the gliding aliens that appear to hinder his quest.

Collect icons to gain extra power and bound over the starspangled black holes to avoid being suspended, lost in inner space."

121818.name: Megablasters
121818.description:
User Summary

An arcade game heavily inspired by Bomberman. The game features 90 levels spread in 11 worlds, each with its own end-of-world boss and theme tune (the game comes on 4 floppy disks). Each time a world is completed the game gives a password to the next world. Up to four players can play, either cooperatively or competitively.

121819.name: Metropol
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121819.description:
User Summary

A Spanish computer game implementation of the classic boardgame Monopoly, for 2 to 4 players.

121820.name: Micro Mouse
121820.description:
User Summary

An arcade game in which the player leads a mouse across a maze-like circuit board. The back of the box says:

"EEK! Dodge Drillers, avoid Pulsers and hide from Homers as you help Micromouse round a circuit board effecting repairs. A challenging maze game packed with frantic action."

121821.name: Master Chess
121821.description:
User Summary

A chess game, with 10 difficulty levels

121822.name: Stunt Bike Simulator
121822.description:
User Summary

A motorcycle stunt game, with 5 different challenges, like an obstacle course, a jump from a hang-glider, jumping through fire hoops...

121823.name: Hidden Mysteries: Salem Secrets – Witch Trials of 1692
121823.description:
Help Constable Hawthorne investigate the rumors of witchcraft in Hidden Mysteries – Salem Secrets, a fun Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game! Four young girls have been suffering from an outbreak of mysterious fits and bizarre tantrums. Rumors abound that the girls have been "afflicted" by local practitioners of Witchcraft, but nobody has yet been charged or tried. Investigate the scenes and uncover the Hidden Mysteries!

Gorgeous graphics
Incredible locations
Solve the Hidden Mystery!




Source: The Publisher Website.

121824.name: Hidden Mysteries: The Forbidden City
121824.description:
In Hidden Mysteries: The Forbidden City take on the role of Evelyn Tao, a bright young professor, who is in town grieving over the death of her father. While exploring her old home she stumbles upon some work left by her father right before he died. After analyzing her father’s journal she realizes that he discovered hidden treasure!

Ancient Chinese Puzzles
25 Authentic Locations!
Hidden Object Gameplay!




Source: The Publisher Website.

121825.name: Hidden Mysteries: Notre Dame – Secrets of Paris
121825.description:
The Crown of Thorns, the most precious and revered relic in the Notre Dame Cathedral, has disappeared. As chief investigator assigned by the Préfecture de Police, it’s up to you to track down the priceless artifact. Use your Hidden Object talents to crack the case in Hidden Mysteries: Notre Dame and save the Crown of Thorns before it’s too late.

Incredible gameplay
Beautiful graphics
Find The Crown of Thorns!




Source: The Publisher Website.

121826.name: Who's Got Game? The Game with Benefits by Neil Strauss
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 82: Gaming in Miniature
Who’s Got Game? The Game with Benefits
121826.description:
SUMMARY:

Neil Strauss, seven-time New York Times bestselling author who brought you the international bestselling seduction books The Game and Rules of the Game is back with one question in mind: “Who’s Got Game?”

“Who’s Got Game?” adds a new twist to being social and can be played anywhere. Whether or not you’re currently a player or playette, there is more game in this box than in most people’s brains. Play it for fun, for training, or for a better social lubricator than alcohol. Like The Game itself, these cards can be used to break the ice and get to know people—whether strangers or your own partner—in minutes.

“Who’s Got Game?” is engineered to bring out the fun and attractive qualities in every player. From physical challenges to personality tests to secret conspiracies, “Who’s Got Game?” has it all. So if you’re looking to turn an ordinary night into a memorable adventure, this is the game for you.

OBJECTIVE:

Players take turns running game (script cards) on each other. The player with the most points after 12 script cards + The Final Challenge wins!

HOW TO PLAY:

Each round, one player is THE LEADER. THE LEADER reads a script card aloud to all the players. The script card, for example, can consist of personality tests, fun loaded questions, charade-like questions, handwriting analysis, palm reading, physical challenges, secret conspiracy missions, and more. The players respond to the script card accordingly. The player(s) who win the round receives points. (The script card states how many points the card is worth.) After each script card is completed, the next player going clockwise becomes THE LEADER. The player with the most points after 12 script cards + The Final Challenge wins.

121827.name: Valhalla Knights
121827.description:
In a realm forgotten by history, humans, elves, halflings and other assorted races lived together in harmony in an untainted paradise surrounded by thick green forests and crystal clear streams. However, this tranquility was abruptly shattered by the roar of demons as the Dark Lord returned to reclaim his throne as the ruler of these lands. This set off a series of bloody battles as all races become ensnared in the violent conflict.

After years of fierce fighting, the Dark Lord was eventually sealed away by the hands of as hero named Rulzult. However, the damage had been done. All the demon blood spilled during the war caused the land to become cursed and the sky lost its light. This once serene paradise became known as "the Cursed Land." It entrapped its inhabitants and filled them with despair, causing each waking moment to feel like an eternity.

One day, a brave youth awakens in this land, unable to recall who he/she is and having no recollection of his/her past. The story continues, following the unknown youth on a journey of discovery to find his/her lost memories and determine the future of this forsaken land.

Source: Wikipedia, "Valhalla Knights", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121828.name: Hidden Mysteries: Vampire Secrets
121828.description:
What was intended as a relaxing vacation to Savannah, Georgia for Claire Donnelly, quickly turned into one of adventure and mystery! Upon her arrival, Claire started experiencing unusual visions, which grew to vivid depictions of evil forces living among the citizens of Savannah. Help Claire explain these terrifying visions in Hidden Mysteries: Vampire’s Secrets, a dark Hidden Object Adventure game.

Mysterious atmosphere
Beautiful scenes
Join Claire on an adventure!




Source: The Publisher Website.

121829.name: Mindtrap
121829.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game in which the player is presented with several row of dice and must switch dice around until they are rearranged in the corresponding columns (1s, 2s...)

The game claims to have one million levels, and each level has its own password.

121830.name: Containment: The Zombie Puzzler
121830.description:
User Summary

Containment: The Zombie Puzzler is loosly based on the match 3 style of casual puzzle game, except that here you are trying to kill zombies by surrounding them with matching units, e.g. Cops, Soldiers, Scientists or Thugs... you can also earn special attacks such as snipers, grenades and even airstrikes.

The other thing that makes it a bit different from the usual matching puzzle games is that the zombies spread over time, infecting your units, so there is an added level of time pressure.

121831.name: Untold Legends: The Warrior's Code
121831.description:
Untold Legends: The Warrior's Code is a sequel to the handheld video game Untold Legends: Brotherhood of the Blade. It was released on March 2006. While very similar to the original in gameplay, Warrior's Code introduced five new character classes, improved controls, a wider array of multiplayer modes, more character customizations, and shorter load times.

Source: Wikipedia, "Untold Legends: The Warrior's Code", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121832.name: Mission Detector
121832.description:
User Summary

A space opera-themed Battleship implementation, with a twist: some ships have defence shields which deflect shots.

121833.name: Wrestling Superstars
121833.description:
User Summary

A budget wrestling simulation. The player must defeat each of the four opponents (Skullbasher Bob, Knucklebuster Nik, Masked Marauder, Golden Guy). Each fight is timed.

121834.name: Monopolic
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121834.description:
User Summary

A computer game implementation of the classic boardgame Monopoly, for 1 to 4 players.

121835.name: Unbound Saga
121835.description:
Unbound Saga is the story of Rick Ajax, a comic book character who is aware he is in a comic. Ajax and fellow comic character Lori Machete seek to confront the artist who created them and be freed from constantly fighting.

Each of the game's two playable characters has a unique animation set and fighting style. Rick uses a fighting style similar to wrestling and can also pick up and throw enemies. Lori's moveset is more reminiscent of kung fu, and she has the ability to use smoke pellets to sneak up on enemies. Characters moves and abilities can be upgraded to more powerful attacks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Unbound Saga", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121836.name: Cerberus
121836.description:
User Summary

A budget vertical scrolling shoot'em up. The back of the box says:

"Emergency signal from Captain of lead ship Cerberus to pirate fleet:
-Immediate assistance required. Have been ambushed by Starfleet Police. Where are you?
But no help will come. Cerberus has been double crossed by the other pirate ships. As Captain of Cerberus you, your crew and your ship must now fight ...ALONE."

121837.name: Corporate Intrigue
121837.description:
From publisher blurb:

You could dabble in organized crime. You could do some smash-and-grabs. You could find all sorts of ways to pick up a few nuyen here and there. But everyone in the Sixth World knows that if you want to make a play for the big bucks, the real high-level stuff, you’ve got to get in bed with the corps.

The corps have the money, and they’ve got all the power that comes with it. If you want to have some of that cash and some of that pull for yourself, you’re going to need to stay alert, move quickly, and remember that while corps are willing to pay for things that help them, deep down they really hate sharing what they’ve got with anyone. Including shadowrunners. Especially shadowrunners.

Corporate Intrigue provides a wealth of plot points and adventure ideas to allow gamemasters to develop corporate-centered campaigns, including plotlines that lead to the discovery of a secret one megacorporation is struggling to contain. Building on information provided in Corporate Guide, Corporate Intrigue provides the story information, location details, and NPC statistics to make running a corporate-themed campaign as easy, fun, and brutal as you want it to be.

121839.name: Street Riders
121839.description:
Street Riders is an urban street racing game on the PlayStation Portable. There is fierce weapon-based combat during races. In total there will be 66 missions, 14 weapons and 30 vehicles. It is based on the console game, 187 Ride or Die.

Source: Wikipedia, "Street Riders", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121841.description:
The Farmageddon: Livestocked and Loaded expansion introduces animals (one per player) to add ranching to the farming side of your operations. Whereas Crops are relatively flimsy and easy to destroy, Animals are permanent. Each Animal will provide many points to your farming operation, assuming you're willing to pay!

The goal for this expansion is to create a balance between tactical Crop management and strategic Animals. It also broadens the strategic choices of the game and adds depth without too much complexity. Players will need to make a choice with their Action cards to lean into animals, crops, or both, to squeak out ahead. Along with the animals will come new Action cards, special animal abilities, and a little bidding to top it off.

In addition to animals, Livestocked and Loaded will introduce Weather Events. These will shake things up so that no game is the same.

The best part is that you won't need to relearn the game. Livestocked and Loaded is built upon the simple framework of the original Farmageddon game. On each turn you're going to Draw Crop cards, Farm and Play Action Cards, then Draw Action cards.
121841.name: Farmageddon: Livestocked and Loaded
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Conversation Thing with Grant Rodiek ep 82.03

121842.name: Avant, Mon Enfants!
121842.description:
Rules for a grand tactical Napoleonic miniatures game. Infantry are mounted three figures to 1"x2" base representing about 400 men. Calvary are mounted two figures to a 2"x2" stand representing about 300 men and horses. Artillery are mounted two men and a gun on a 2"x3" stand and represent about 200 men and 8 to 12 guns. Each turn represents one hour of game time.

On his a turn, a player moves any and all units up to their movement allowance, then declares attacks. An attack is resolved based on the combat factors of the units, the unit characteristics, and terrain.

The rulebook contains no information on how to design scenarios. Players sometimes recreated historical battles or historical what-ifs. Sometimes they played miscellaneous forces with no historical context. Many games were played as part of campaigns.

121843.name: Scarface: Money. Power. Respect
121843.description:
Scarface: Money. Power. Respect. is a turn-based strategy game featuring both single and multiplayer modes.
The game challenges the player to make strategic decisions to rise to power and to direct an army of gunmen while fighting. In single-player story mode the player will direct strategic city-wide commands to dominate street-level real time combat. The game challenges the player to handle large territory, adversaries and profit-making opportunities through drug trafficking. In multiplayer mode it pits four players as criminal cartels in a race to gain money and turf. Through turn based showdowns and real time combat each player will manage production and distribution of drugs, build up enough cartel strength to overpower adversaries, conquer turf and rule the Miami drug scene.

Source: Wikipedia, "Scarface: Money Power Respect", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121844.name: Superkid
121844.description:
User Summary

A platform game in which you must save young girls stranded on rooftops and escort elder people to their homes while battling criminals. A level is finished once you've helped all the citizens. The back of the box says:

"Set in New York in the year 2089, the city has become a no-go area for ordinary citizens as the street gangs conduct open warfare. Crime is rampant and the streets are littered with the dead bodies of innocent citizens and gang members alike. A super hero is needed to clean up the city. Enter...Superkid."

121845.name: Superkid In Space
121845.description:
User Summary

Superkid is back in a new adventure. This time Superkid has a gun to shoot aliens, and must recover nuclear detonators on 4 planetships in order to blow them up. The back of the box says:

"The world has been surrounded by alien forces who have moved their planetships towards earth in search of minerals and other riches. The world leaders have been threatened with the total destruction of Planet Earth if they show any resistance. There is only one hope for mankind...Superkid."

121846.name: Cavemania
121846.description:
User Summary

A prehistoric themed platform game. The back of the box says:

"Fed up with Brontosaurus steaks, Ug has set his heart on the fresh Pterodactyl eggs that he can see on a ledge high up in the cliffs. Help Ug to avoid the erupting volcanoes and fight the fearsome dinosaurs in his quest to steal the eggs and carry them safely back to his cave.

121847.name: Nemesis IV
121847.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the classic abstract game Othello: http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/2389/othello

121848.name: O'thelo
121848.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the classic game Othello: http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/2389/othello

121849.name: Damas
121849.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the classic game Checkers.

121850.name: Rugby League Challenge
121850.description:
Rugby League Challenge allows players to play through the entire season, through to the Grand Final. It features a team management system where players can be trained up in skills such as kicking, tackling and running.

The game also features a quick match mode, as well as the season mode. Multiple camera angles are available to choose from both in the options menu and while playing the game. Camera angles range from close behind the player to wide zooms showing most of the stadium.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rugby League Challenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121851.name: Bestiary
121851.description:
Bestiary is a simple card driven two player game in which players create chimeras by adding different creature parts.

Drawing creature part cards from a common deck, players take turns to put them into play. When a card is played, a control marker is placed on it. Creature parts can be tails, middle parts or heads. A chimera is completed when it has a tail and a head. Several chimeras may be incomplete at the same time. A player may choose to discard a card and draw a new one instead of playing a card, or may choose to pass. When two players pass consecutively or the deck is depleted, the game ends. Players then earn score according to the sum of values printed on the creature part cards they played which form completed chimeras.

121853.name: Empire
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121853.description:
User Summary

A turn-based strategy game in which one to four players take on the role of Roman conquerors. They must manage their provinces, build up infrastructures, manage the economy and raise armies to defend their territories and annex enemy provinces.

121854.name: Octoplex
121854.description:
User Summary

An action game in which you must escape maze after maze while dodging enemy creatures and finding your way around the many types of gates. The back of the box says:

"Deep in the heart of a giant molecular compound, imprisoned by the evil wizard Zolt, you have but one desperate wish - to escape."

121855.name: Rocky Balboa
121855.description:
The game contains a variety of different modes. Historical Fights is the main game mode, which pits Rocky against all of his various opponents throughout the franchise.
There are 27 different character selections possible. There are separate versions of Rocky which vary in age, weight (depending on the film) and clothes (black/gold, white/red variations). There are alternative versions of Apollo Creed and Tommy Gunn has two different selectable outfits. The player can choose from 18 different arenas to fight in, including many of the film franchises major boxing arenas, such as the Philadelphia arena and Las Vegas.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rocky Balboa (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121856.name: Othello Master
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121856.description:
User Summary

An implementation of the classic game Othello: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/2389/othello

For one or two players, isometric 3d graphics.

121857.name: Parabola
121857.description:
User Summary

A platform/puzzle game in isometric 3d, in which the player must guide a droid on tiles to collect energy discs, while avoiding hazards. The game manual says:

"Bouncing Bruce, a service droid has got himself lost on the cosmic energy grid. You must guide him across each square of the grid to the exit gate, collecting any rotating energy discs along the way. Take care though, passage across the square is made hazardous by the presence of direction changing blocks, round ejection discs and moving guards.

Once the energy discs have been collected and Bruce has reached the exit, the square will become neutralised and he can attempt the next chosen square on the grid. Lastly, Bruce being a delicate droid, it's advisable not to bounce him too high as he will shatter on impact."

121858.name: Pasteman Pat
121858.description:
User Summary

An action/sliding puzzle game in which the player must guide Pat the Pasteman as he paste his posters while dodging detritus thrown at him by angry rivals. The posters are split in several bits which must be correctly aligned in order to complete a level. The game has 12 difficulty levels and 12 different posters.

121860.name: Analogue: A Hate Story
videogamehonor: 2013 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee
121860.description:
Back in the 25th century, Earth launched a generation ship into deep space, with the goal of establishing the first interstellar colony. It dropped out of contact and disappeared, never reaching its destination.

Thousands of years later, it has finally been found.

Source: The Game Website.

121861.name: Pick'N Pile
121861.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game in which the player must get rid of coloured balls by building columns of identical balls. Balls are moved by switching places between them or with a blank spot. If the player is left with balls that don't match, another row of balls can be summoned. Apart from coloured balls, various bonuses or dangerous items can also appear on the playing surface. Each level is timed.

121862.name: Play Bac
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121862.description:
User Summary

A computer adaptation of the French trivia boardgame of the same name. 2000 questions, 1 to 6 players.

121863.description:
The set of Inuit Fisherman Cards for the Fleet game is a fun and strategic expansion. (8 Cards)

Inuit Fisherman - Inuit are the native people of Nunavut, Canada. With the Nunavut Land Claims Agreement Act in place, Inuit fisherman can fish in Ridback Bay without a license, but still reap all of its benefits!

The power of the Inuit Fisherman is that he does not require a license to launch and NO captain needed! The best part is he still catches fish and counts towards all the applicable bonuses (launch, captain, and VP). Inuit Fisherman is a great card set that can be added right to Fleet and provide additional strategy and flexibility.
121863.name: Fleet: Inuit Fisherman

121864.name: Quack A Jack
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121864.description:
User Summary

An action/puzzle game in which you must lead Red Jack the Pirate King (a duck) as he investigates the Palace Dungeons. You must dodge monsters, squash eggs before they hatch more monsters, and help yourself to the creatures' wages they carelessly leave lying around. The floor disappears as Red Jack moves, but he can move flagstones around.

121865.name: Quadrel
videogameversion: France Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
121865.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game based on the four colours theorem (any surface divided in any number of rectangles can be painted by only four colours without two adjacent rectangles being of the same colour). There are 3 game modes: free (the player has limited colours but can choose the rectangle to paint), imposed (the computer chooses which rectangle to paint), and match, either against a human opponent or the computer. In this mode each player has a different set of paints and the goal is to prevent your opponent from using her colours while emptying your pots.

121866.name: Crime Fighter
121866.description:
from the back of the box:

Crime Fighter is an action-packed role-playing system with all the excitement and drama of the TV cop shows. Whether its an armed robbery in progress or a crime boss that must be brought to justice, you'll be there 'Code 3.'

paraphrased from page 1:
Contains:
1 rulebook, 64pp
1 player reference card, double sided
1 errata sheet
6 sheets of map boards, 2 per sheet
2 sheets of counters, one of 54 and one of 50.
3 d6 (pipped)
1 ziplock (quart sized)

121867.name: Phantoms of the Ice: Tricks
121867.description:
This is a one card mini expansion which was included in the White Wind game Rainbows to promote their games Tricks and Phantoms of the Ice.

The expansion consists of a new goalie named Tricks and a rules card. Tricks has a value of "0" but can foretell the defeat of his team. If he is right, the losing team wins the game, if he is wrong, he must be discarded.

121869.name: Phantoms of the Ice: Rainbows
121869.description:
This is a one card mini expansion which was included in the White Wind game Tricks to promote the games Rainbows and Phantoms of the Ice.

The expansion consists of a new foward player named Rainbows and a rules card. Rainbows has only a value of "1", but before a match, you may select one player from your opponent's hand and switch it with one of your players.

121870.name: Phantoms of the Ice: Elfenwizard
121870.description:
This is a one card mini expansion which was given out by the German online game store "Adam Spielt".

The expansion consists of a new defense named Elfenwizard and a rules card. Elfenwizard has only a value of "1" but if you have Elfenwizard in your team, you may perform two actions each turn.

121871.name: Dungeon Village
121871.description:
Build a flourishing RPG town
that warriors and merchants
alike will flock to!

Source: The Game Website.

121872.name: Dominate
121872.description:
Dominate is a two-player game of area domination with deceptively simple rules.

The game is played on a square 9 x 9 game board with 3 x 3 sub-regions enclosed in boxes – a Sudoku grid without numbers. For game purposes, the board can be broken down into 27 overlapping regions each containing nine squares. There are nine rows, nine columns and nine 3x3 boxes.

The board is empty at the start of the game.

Players take turns placing one, two or three stones as an orthogonally connected group on empty squares. Swap rules apply. Players may not pass a turn.

A player dominates a region by occupying any 5 or more squares in the region. The game is won by dominating 14 or more regions on the board.

121873.name: March 2012: The Rag and Bone Man
121873.description:
From Introduction:

The Rag and Bone Man was once a fixture of city streets, trading bits of rags, bones and scrap metal to later sell to factories that would melt down into raw material. The niche for the Rag and Bone Man’s industry existed because many people lacked the means to haul their own scrap away or transport such material away from their homes. A similar trait follows the homeless, who travel the streets picking through garbage for any recyclable materials to sell. A true Rag and Bone Man, however, is one who makes a business out of this endeavor. In the event of a zombie apocalypse, a civilization can be brought completely to its knees. A person who dedicates their time to picking through ruins to fi nd useful things to sell or trade is not only a viable profession, but in some cases a necessary industry in and of itself. A group of survivors will often find a Rag and Bone Man as a welcome sight as they can potentially barter with them in order to fi nd any supplies that the survivors themselves have been unable to find. Less scrupulous people would rob the Rag and Bone Man, but this would be akin killing the goose that lays the golden eggs. A Stronghold might find it in their best interest to provide amnesty and protect Rag and Bone Men, for giving them the ability to search the nearby area for useful supplies and offering their wares for sale or in exchange for a safe place to call home.

121877.description:
The Eggsclusive is a set of limited edition Rooster cards you can use in the Chicken Caesar game! Players can replace some of their own roosters with these eager chickens during game setup. The following roosters are included in this expansion:


Abus I - A somewhat familiar looking rooster for you history buffs.
Baro I - This is another one for the history buffs and Peanuts. The most famous fighter pilot of all time.
Plusho I - Plusho isn't exactly what you would expect from a Roman chicken politician, but sometimes just the "appearance" of leadership will do the trick.
Cucullo I - "Hood" in Latin; this particular chap might remind you of a certain vigilante who steals from the rich to give to the poor.
Magus I - This Rooster resembles a certain magic peddler who was once a little grey-er.


Note: Stevus I was removed from The Eggsclusive due to legal concerns.
121877.name: Chicken Caesar: The Eggsclusive

121878.description:
Sometimes you have to fight dirty to win.

The Fowl Play Expansion for the Chicken Caesar game comes with 8 new Rooster cards, each with unique art and abilities. Players can replace some of their own roosters with these eager chickens during game setup to amp up the nastiness.
121878.name: Chicken Caesar: Fowl Play Expansion

121879.name: The Elder Elemental Eye
121879.description:
From Wizards.com:

Adventure Background: The Elder Elemental Eye

Long ago, the Sabrak clan of dwarves, in an effort to restore their clan’s lost power and status, meddled with dark forces in the Sunset Mountains. The dwarves succeeded only in creating their own isolation and madness. Their clan grew smaller and ever more degenerate—so that today, only the three brothers who lead the clan and a handful of other dwarves remain. Of the three brothers, Zarnak, the eldest and most powerful, is a seer whose mind shattered long ago when it came into contact with an ancient evil known as the Elder Elemental Eye... and who now plots to spread the abyssal plague throughout the world.

121880.name: Rasterscan
121880.description:
User Summary

The spaceship Rasterscan is damaged and adrift, you must take control of the only functional repair droid aboard and fix the ship. The player controls a bouncing ball, which can pick up and drop items. Dropping an item in the right place will restore some of the ship's functions, giving access to more areas or activating additional ship functions. The game manual says:

"The game takes place aboard a large spaceship, the Rasterscan. After a skirmish the Rasterscan is badly crippled and drifting helplessly towards a star.
The player takes the role of a small robot by the name of M.S.B. Unfortunately M.S.B.'s only remaining program is how to repair toasters and it hasn't a clue how to operate the spaceship.
The object of the game is to repair and control the Rasterscan preferably before it collides with the star!"

121881.name: Reckless Rufus
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121881.description:
User Summary

An action/puzzle game in which Rufus must collect crystals while avoiding or shooting aliens. Rufus moves by jumping from stone to stone. If he's standing on a "4" stone, he'll jump one space and a "3" stone will be created under him. There are special stones (teleporters, switches, extra ammo...). Aliens can be shot but Rufus has limited ammo.

There are 130 levels, split in two parts. The game manual says:

"Having hidden aboard the vast mining ship, the Astro Cruiser, hoping to save a fortune on a cheap year return ticket to Earth, Rufus had goofed! He had been caught trying to buy some liquorice sweets from a deactivated android - pretty dumb huh!

As a result, Admiral Greave had beamed our reckless hero on to the planet Killey and told him to collect as many of the rare crystals found there as possible and only then would the Admiral decide whether or not to take him back to Earth.

The problems for Rufus were not to stop at simply finding sufficient crystals, but became more complicated with the existence of deadly traps and an infestation of hostile aliens. Fortunately, Rufus had been given a laser gun, although it had a limited supply of laser bullets.

Will Rufus make it or is he doomed from the start?"

121882.name: R.E.M.
121882.description:
User Summary

R.E.M. stands for "Remote Excavation Module". The game is a Boulder Dash clone in which the player controls the module and must dig out radioactive material while avoiding rockfalls.

121883.name: Springe (Two-Fisted Bluff)
121883.description:
Springe (Two-Fisted Bluff) is a two-player game designed for play with a Shibumi set. It uses a 4×4-holed board, and balls in three colors (white, black, and red).

Aim: Make a full line (orthogonal or diagonal) of your color on a level, or get 9 of your balls on the board, or place the top piece of the pyramid, or (if both players run out of balls to play) have more of your balls in play than your opponent and more of yours than neutral balls.

Rules: The 4×4 board starts empty. Each player (White and Black) starts with his 16 balls, and 8 of the red neutral balls. Keep this supply of 24 balls hidden from your opponent at all times during the game. Use an opaque container (e.g. the Shibumi bag) to receive rejected balls over the course of the game. It should be able to hold all 48 balls, just in case. Never look in this reject bag during the game.
On your turn, hide any one or two balls total from your supply into your two hands. Each hand now has zero or one ball in it. Now present your closed fists to your opponent. Your opponent must sit still (no leaning and peeking), then touch one of your fists. Put the ball in this hand (if any) on the growing pyramid. Put the other hand (without looking!) into the reject bag, and release the ball (if any). Always do this, even if the other hand is empty, in order to keep your opponent guessing as to which balls you have left. If you run out of balls before your opponent, simply pass each turn until the game is over: You will still select which hand your opponent gets to play each turn.

121884.name: Spandrel
121884.description:
Spandrel is derived from Spaiji, and is a three-player game designed for play with a Shibumi set. It uses a 4×4-holed board, and balls in three colors (white, black, and red).

Rules: The 4×4 board starts empty. The players, White, Black, and Red, take turns placing one ball of each color (yes, all three colors) in a contiguous, touching chain on the growing pyramid. The balls can be placed on board holes and/or on top of 2×2 platforms. The three balls can go on the growing pyramid in any orientation, as long as one of the three balls touches the two others.

Aim: The player with the largest group of connected balls of her color when the pyramid is full wins. In case of a tie, the last player in turn order wins (i.e. Red beats Black beats White in a tie).

121885.name: Spurn
121885.description:
Spurn is a three-player game (inspired by Néstor Romeral Andrés’ Spuzzle) designed for play with a Shibumi set. It uses a 4×4-holed board, and balls in three colors (white, black, and red).

Aim: Be the last player to create a group of four or more balls of your color.

Rules: The 4×4 board starts empty. The players, White, Black, and Red, take turns placing one ball of their own color on the growing pyramid. If you create a group of four or more of your balls, you are eliminated, and will add no more balls to the pyramid.

121886.name: Empire War
121886.description:
User Summary

Empire War is a tower defense AND real-time strategy game at the same time. You can play both modes offense and defense. There is a huge war between mankind and chaos and you are the best hope to win the war.

121887.name: Spruit
121887.description:
Spruit is a solitaire game designed for play with a Shibumi set. It uses a 4×4-holed board, and balls in three colors (white, black, and red).

Aim: Score the most points you can, without losing the game by disconnecting a white or a black the others of its kind.

Setup: The 4×4 board starts with the 16 base holes filled as shown to the right.
The game is played from the 3×3 level up. Empty the bag, and put 5 balls of each color (white, black, and red) into the bag.

Rules: Draw a ball from the bag, and add it to the pyramid according to these rules: When there are no free spaces on a level, you may place the ball on any edge point of the new level; otherwise, you must push a ball from the side with a new ball. White and black balls must end up touching others of their kind; red needn’t do this. If a white or black becomes stranded, you lose. You may not push balls off the pyramid.

Once the last ball is on the pyramid, you score according to the following:
7 points for a visibly connected path of red from corner to corner; otherwise, red is worthless.
A color (black or white) that is split into separate visible groups is worth the product of the number of balls in each visible group of that color.
A color (black or white) that is in one contiguous visible group is worth negative the number of balls in that visible group.
Random Setup: Start with the two red balls in the corner, then put 11 white and 11 black in the bag. Spiral clockwise inward from one of the reds, drawing a ball from the bag and adding it to the board. Now spiral clockwise inward again from the same red, and each time you reach a white or black that is not touching any others of its kind, replace it with the other kind from the bag. (Apologies for the difficulty in replacing the center four!) Note: The base may thus contain more groups than just one white and one black.
After setup, dump the bag, and put the usual 5 white, 5 black, 5 red in the bag to start the game.
When playing with random setup, you should play several games in a row with the same setup, so you can really experience the setup.

Multi-player Solitaire: Any number of people can compete, as long as each person has a Shibumi set. If you do a random setup, everyone should copy one random setup, so everyone starts with the same base. If players can see each others’ pyramids, each player should draw randomly from her own bag during the game; if players cannot see each others’ pyramids, you can have one person draw from her bag the whole game, announcing the color drawn, and the other players simply pull out that color and place it. The latter allows for more pure competition, but the former is often more practical.

121888.name: Reveal
videogameversion: English / European ZX Spectrum & Amstrad CPC Cassette edition
121888.description:
User Summary

A Marble Madness clone. The back of the box says:

"Battle against the clock and marauding enemies as you attempt to free each screen from darkness in this challenging and perplexing arcade puzzle game."

The game manual says:

"At the outset of each level, the world you must free is shown briefly before it is blacked out. Take careful note of this, as you will not get another look at the entire level until it is completed. By travelling over the square sectors that make up each chequered world you can illuminate it. When all the squares have been illuminated, the exit square for that level flashes and must be reached before the time limit expires to teleport to the next world."

"Become trapped on a 'dead end' square, your only alternative is to commit suicide. As the game progresses, more alien enemies are introduced and the hidden paths for each level become more difficult to negociate. Points are awarded for revealing squares, with a bonus given upon the completion of each level, and additional points awarded for time remaining."

121889.name: Sprenge
121889.description:
Sprenge is a three-player game designed for play with a Shibumi set. It uses a 4×4-holed board, and balls in three colors (white, black, and red).

Rules: The 4×4 board starts empty. The players, White, Black, and Red, take turns placing one ball of each of their opponent’s colors (e.g. White plays a black and a red) anywhere on the growing pyramid — they don’t need to be touching one another. The balls can be placed on board holes and/or on top of 2×2 platforms.

Aim: The player with the largest group of connected balls of her color when the pyramid is full wins. In case of a tie, the first player in turn order wins (i.e. White beats Black beats Red in a tie).

121890.name: Sia Doble
121890.description: Sia Doble appears to be a two-player version of Oliver Schaudt's Sia Solo, a solitaire puzzle game in which the solver tries to swap the positions of two large stones on the game board. In Sia Doble, each player has three large stones and – I'm saying this based totally on gut-feeling – needs to place those stones in the starting spaces of the opponent's stones in order to win.

121891.name: Reversi Champion
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121891.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of Reversi, an Othello variant in which the starting positions are not fixed. The game has six difficulty levels and several modes (training, demonstration, problem solving), and a library of over 4000 openings.

121892.name: Rockford
121892.description:
User Summary

A self-confessed Boulder Dash clone, with a few gameplay twists. The manual says:

"On each of the five exciting worlds that you will be adventuring over, you will face a fresh set of mindtwistingly difficult puzzles, and a new range of mayhem wreaking monsters and a different type of treasure hoard. Each of the worlds contains four difficulty levels. Each of these levels is completely different from any of the others. There is a complete range of challenges, for every one of the sixteen screens that makes up a world has hundreds of puzzles for you to solve as you try to collect all of the treasure without ending up crushed under a rock."

121893.name: Puzzle of Oz
121893.description:
David Parlett's Puzzle of Oz was initially designed as a solitaire puzzle played as follows: Five stones in each of five colors are placed in a bag. Draw four stones and place them in the four outer squares of the playing area, which resembles a fat plus sign. Then draw the remaining stones one at a time, placing each stone next to a stone already in position. If no two orthogonally adjacent stones are of the same color, you win.

For this release, Parlett has included rules so that two players can compete against one another.

121894.name: Schnack nich... Dat geit!!!
121894.description: Players take turns adding wooden pieces of different shapes to a fragile tower. They also need to get their two playing pieces onto the tower. One piece is lighter the other heavier. Once in a while (the length of this while is determined by a random element), there are scoring breaks. The players then check the positions of their pieces and multiply the number of levels one piece is up with the number of levels the other piece is hanging over the edge of the board. When all pieces have been built, the game ends and the player with most points wins. If a player topples the tower before that, that player is the sole loser.

121895.name: Little Association
121895.description:
The box contains three plastic animals, a rabbit, a frog and a cow. Three large "theme" tiles, the vegetable garden (linked to the rabbit), the pond (frog) and the meadow (cow). Each large tile depicts a scene containing a combination of 10 animals, vegetables, tools... For example the scarecrow is on the vegetable garden tile and the dragonfly in the pond tile. There are also 30 smaller tiles each depicting one of the things present on the larger theme tiles.

The smaller tiles are placed head down in the center of the table. The top one is returned and the children need to identify which theme the card belongs to. The winner is the first child to place the corresponding animal on the correct theme tile. He gains the small card and the next one is then revealed. If the player gets it wrong, he puts a previously gained card back under the pack in the middle of the table.

The game winner is the first to gain 5 cards or the one with most cards once all the cards in the center have been used.

121897.name: Countdown
121897.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the UK TV game "Countdown" (which was an adaptation of the French TV game "Des Chiffres et des Lettres"). Two contestants face several rounds of word and number puzzles. In the word round, players are given 9 letters and must find the longest word possible. In the numbers round, players are given 6 numbers, and must use some or all of these numbers to reach a random 3-digit number by using basic maths.

The winner is the player with the most points at the end of a round.

121898.name: Mimanca
121898.description:
The game consists of three tracks, laid out by tiles: An inner one that both players use and two outer ones, used by only one player each. At the outset of the game, each player places three pieces on each tile in the two lanes s/he can use.
Afterwards, the players take turns picking up all the pieces from one tile, then moving the pieces onward in the designated direction (the tracks are one-way and form a "round" track for each player, with the middle track being part of both players' tracks). At each tile they pass, they have to drop one piece. In the middle, they can choose which color to drop (if they have both colors in their hand), but when they reach the end of the middle track, the pieces are split up and continue their path in the different outer tracks.
If a tile on the outer tracks ever contains more than six pieces, that tile is removed together with all the pieces on it.
During the game, there are scorings at partially random moments. Each player counts the number of pieces on his or her outer track and gets points accordingly.
The game ends when one player has less than three tiles in his or her outer track. Then a final scoring is done, with the other player scoring double. The player with most points wins.

121899.name: Volumina
121899.description:
Each player has a set of pieces consisting of different numbers of assembled cubes (resulting in different shapes). Beginning with a random start player, they take turns placing a piece on the base board. The following rules apply:
- A player maynot play the same piece as the other player immediately afterwards
- The piece may not touch the last piece played by the other player
- The piece may not have any parts hanging in the air, reaching over the edge of the board or reach a height of more than 5 cubes.
When a player has managed to get rid of all his/her pieces (or neither player can legally play another piece), the game ends, and the player(s) who still hold pieces count the number of cubes they have left. This is the negative score. After two plays, the player with the lowest overall negative score is the winner.

121900.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Throughout the "Dwarrowdelf" cycle for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game, the heroes of Middle-earth have been tasked by Elrond to find the root of the increased Orc activity in the Misty Mountains. Through treacherous mountain passes, goblin ambushes, dark tunnels, and underground waterways, their journey leads them at last to the depths of Moria...and the terrible discovery that awaits them!

Shadow and Flame is the climactic final Adventure Pack in the "Dwarrowdelf" cycle. Its sixty cards introduce a new hero, three copies of each player card, and conclude the epic saga's narrative arc with an all-new scenario that pits the heroes of Middle-earth against a demon from the times of Morgoth in the fight of their lives!
121900.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Shadow and Flame
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Shadow and Flame
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Khazad-dûm
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

121901.name: Spaced Out
121901.description:
User Summary

A turn-based puzzle game in which the player moves a character on a square grid. The character starts on one end of the grid and must reach the opposit end. Each turn, the game rolls two six-sided dice, and the character can move twice, in any orthogonal direction, the number of squares indicated by the die roll (for example, if 4 and 2 come out, 4 steps to the east and 2 steps to the north). The computer controls monsters who can block the character's path but can be eliminated if the character lands on the same square as the monster. Grid size and number of monsters can be changed at the beginning of the game.

121904.name: Spherical
videogameversion: English Commodore Amiga 3.5" Disk (Top Shots Re-release) edition
English European Atari ST 3.5" Disk edition
English European Commodore Amiga 3.5" Disk edition
English European ZX Spectrum 3" Disk edition
English European ZX Spectrum Cassette (Top Shots re-release) edition
English European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
English/German Commodore Amiga 3.5" Disk (Top Shots Re-release) edition
Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121904.description:
User Summary

A fantasy action/puzzle game heavily inspired by Solomon's Key. You must help a ball move to the exit by building a path of stone blocks. You can create or destroy blocks on your level or a level below. Each level has various bonuses like a shield or speed boost, and monsters which you must avoid as they drain energy. Some level have a special guardian monster that must be destroyed in order to progress.

The game has more than 200 levels (only 80 levels on the Amstrad CPC version), a system of password to move to a previously completed level, and can be played alone or in coop mode.

121905.name: Survivors
121905.description:
User Summary

A game heavily inspired by Boulder Dash. Tunnel through mud and rocks in order to rescue your people. The game manuial says:

"Your mission is to rescue almost a thousand survivors from a hibernation dome, damaged in the recent nuclear war. To complete the task you must guide three Droids through the 7 levels of the building and teleport the survivors to safety.

Each of the Droids has a different function. Droid 1 can tunnel through tons of earth at high speed, Droid 2 is a very advanced droid whose function is to teleport the survivors to safety, and Droid 3 is a droid of immense strength, used for moving fallen boulders (although even he can only move one at a time)."

121906.name: Swap
121906.description:
User Summary

Puzzle game. Each level is a mosaic of pieces of different colours. The player can swap two pieces by clicking on their junction. If one of the pieces ends up adjacent to a piece of the same colour, they both disappear. The goal is to clear each level of pieces. The game has two modes, normal and tournament. In tournament mode how far you progress in the game depends on your score. If you score too low, you may even regress and end up in an earlier level.

121907.name: The Moors Challenge
121907.description:
User Summary

A computer game implementation of the classic game Othello.

121908.name: The Tiny Skweeks
121908.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game. Skweek's numerous offspring were on their way to a youth camp but they decided they wanted to see Earth instead and hijacked their space shuttle. Skweek has sent you a telegram warning you, and now you must catch each of Skweek's children before they reach Earth and start painting everything pink.

Each level has several skweeks of different colours. You must move each of them to a tile matching their colour. Once a skweek is ordered to move in a direction, she doesn't stop until she reaches an obstacle. There are many obstacles, like one-way tiles, teleporters, ice...), as well as bonuses that can be picked up if a skweek walks on it.

There are 101 levels, each with a password.

121909.name: Think!
121909.description:
User Summary

A computer game implementation of the classic game Connect 4, with a twist: each time a player plays a piece in a column, it moves every other piece in the same column one step.

121910.name: Y'ahtzee
121910.description:
User Summary

A Spanish computer game implementation of the classic dice game Yahtzee, for one to six players.

121911.name: Rüls of the Void
rpghonor: 2011 Indie RPG Award - Best Free Game - Runner-Up
121911.description:
From the introduction:

Ten years ago, the powers of Earth and their many solar colonies erupted into vicious, system-wide war. With terrible weapons at their disposal, both sides reduced every planet and moon to irradiated dustballs. Years of mass starvation and deprivation later, survivors strain out a living by scavenging what remains on derelict ships, stations, and bases. We, the “heirs” of Earth, have become vultures of the vast, lonely void. We pick over the carrion of a golden age of plenty, when Humanity had the luxury of building whatever we desired.

121912.name: Derelicts of the Void
121912.description:
User Summary:
A derelict supplement for Void Vultures. 24 pages of munitions factories, cryogenic day spas and other sites to plunder and be eaten by.

121913.name: W.A.R.
121913.description:
User Summary

A budget vertical scrolling shoot'em up by Martech.

Tiny game window, one player only.

121914.name: Battlemat
121914.description:
User summary:
